title: 72. SOUR CREAM CUCUMBER SOUP
info:
SOUR CREAM CUCUMBER SOUP

ingredients

3 medium cucumbers
1/2 c. chopped onions
2 Tbsp. butter
1 Tbsp. flour
2 c. rich chicken broth
1 tsp. seasoned salt
1 1/2 c. dairy sour cream
3/4 Tbsp. lemon juice
1/8 tsp. dried dill

preparation

Pare and slice 2 cucumbers (about 3 cups). Cook with onions in butter until soft. Stir in flour; add broth slowly. Cover; simmer until cucumbers are tender, about 10 minutes. Cool slightly; add seasoned salt. Whirl smooth in blender or processor. Chill well. Pare remaining cucumber and scoop out seeds. Grate the cucumber medium coarse. Add to chilled soup base along with sour cream. Blend in lemon juice and dill.

The base can be made ahead and placed in refrigerator. At the last minute add grated cucumber, sour cream, lemon and dill. Makes about 1 1/2 quarts. Serves 6.

title: 87. CHUNKY PIZZA SOUP
info:
CHUNKY PIZZA SOUP

ingredients

1 Tbsp. olive oil
1 small onion, chopped
1 green pepper, chopped
1/2 c. sliced mushrooms
1 (28 oz.) can plum tomatoes, undrained
1 c. beef stock
1/4 c. fresh basil, chopped or 1 tsp. dry basil
1 c. thinly sliced pepperoni
1 c. shredded Mozzarella cheese
1/4 c. Parmesan cheese

preparation

In saucepan heat oil; add onion, pepper and mushrooms. Stir-fry until soft, but not browned. Add tomatoes, stock, basil and pepperoni; cook until heated through. Mix 2 cheeses; ladle soup into 4 ovenproof bowls. Sprinkle with cheese. Broil until cheese melts. Or microwave on High for 1 1/2 minutes. Serve immediately with some warm crusty French bread. Makes 4 servings.

title: 35. ORIENTAL SOUP
info:
ORIENTAL SOUP

ingredients

5 chicken bouillon cubes
4 c. boiling water
1 c. fresh spinach leaves or watercress leaves
1/2 c. (small can) water chestnuts, drained and sliced
1 c. bean sprouts, drained
soy sauce to taste

preparation

Dissolve bouillon cubes in water and simmer spinach or watercress just until tender. Add remaining ingredients and simmer 2 more minutes. Serves 5 generously.

title: 165. CHEESY POTATO SOUP
info:
CHEESY POTATO SOUP

ingredients

5 c. diced potatoes
1 1/2 c. diced carrots
1 1/2 c. diced celery
1 c. diced onion
2 tsp. salt
water
1 can evaporated milk
1 c. half and half
2 c. Velveeta cheese (1/2 large brick)
1/4 c. butter
pepper to taste
2 c. cooked and diced ham

preparation

Combine potatoes, carrots, celery and onion in a large pot. Add salt and enough water to cover the vegetables. Boil for about 20 minutes or until vegetables are soft. Slightly mash some (but not all) of the potatoes. Take mixture off stove. Stir in the rest of the ingredients. Return to stove and heat on medium-low until cheese is melted and soup is bubbly.

title: 75. CORN CHOWDER SOUP
info:
CORN CHOWDER SOUP

ingredients

2 to 3 strips bacon
1 onion, diced
2 potatoes, cubed
1/2 c. water
1 can cream-style corn
2 c. milk
1/2 tsp. salt
1 c. finely sliced ham
1/2 c. Cheddar cheese, grated

preparation

Fry bacon (2 or 3 strips) until crisp. Remove bacon and fry onion until limp. Add potatoes and water; boil until potatoes are done. Add corn, milk, salt and ham. Top with cheese and bacon. Simmer.

title: 185. CRAB SOUP
info:
CRAB SOUP

ingredients

1 bunch green onions
1 lb. crabmeat
1/4 c. butter
1 tsp. liquid crab boil
1 stick butter
1 can cream of mushroom soup
2 soup cans whole milk
1 pt. half and half

preparation

Melt 1/4 cup of butter. Add green onions and sauté for 15 minutes. Add all other ingredients and simmer for 30 minutes. Do not allow mixture to boil.

title: 187. HOMEMADE VEGETABLE SOUP
info:
HOMEMADE VEGETABLE SOUP

ingredients

1 chuck roast, cut up
1 onion, chopped
1/2 bell pepper, chopped
2 to 3 onion tops, chopped
1/2 tsp. parsley flakes
1/2 tsp. garlic, minced
1/4 tsp. cayenne pepper
2 potatoes, diced
2 cans tomato sauce
1 can Ro-Tel
1/2 can whole tomatoes, cut up
2 cans whole kernel corn
2 cans sweet peas
1 can cut green beans
1 can lima beans

preparation

In a large pot, add meat and water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer partially covered for about 1 hour or until meat is tender. Skim off any fat and scum that may form from boiling. Next, add all other ingredients, except potatoes and cook for about 1 to 2 hours. Season to taste. Add your potatoes; you can also add spaghetti (about 1/4 of the bag), broken in 3, at the same time as the potatoes.

title: 51. CHEDDAR-CHICKEN SOUP
info:
CHEDDAR-CHICKEN SOUP

ingredients

2 Tbsp. margarine
1/2 c. chopped onion
1/2 c. chopped celery
1/2 c. chopped carrot
2 tsp. all purpose flour
1 c. water
1 pkg. instant chicken broth and seasoning mix
1/2 c. frozen asparagus cuts and tips
1/2 c. skim milk
2 oz. Cheddar cheese, shredded
4 oz. skinned and boned cooked chicken, diced
1 c. cooked small macaroni (shells, tubetti or elbows)
1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
dashes of salt and white pepper

preparation

In 1 1/2 to 2-quart saucepan heat margarine over medium heat until bubbly and hot; add onion, celery and carrot and sauté until vegetables are tender. Sprinkle vegetables with flour and stir quickly to combine; gradually stir in water. Add broth mix and, stirring constantly, bring to a boil. Add asparagus and cook, stirring, for about 3 minutes; add milk and cheese and continue stirring and cooking until cheese melts. Reduce heat to low, add remaining ingredients, and cook until thoroughly heated.

title: 58. CHICKEN MULLIGATAWNY SOUP
info:
CHICKEN MULLIGATAWNY SOUP

ingredients

1 1/2 c. diced apple
2 Tbsp. flaked coconut
2 Tbsp. chopped onion
1 1/2 tsp. curry powder (or less)
2 Tbsp. butter or oleo
1 can cream of chicken soup
1/2 soup can milk
1/4 c. plain yogurt

preparation

In saucepan, cook apple, coconut and onion with curry in butter until tender. Add soup; pour into blender and blend until smooth. Return mixture to saucepan; gradually stir in milk and yogurt. Heat and stir occasionally. Garnish with sliced apple. Makes about 3 cups or 4 servings.

title: 233. BROCCOLI AND CHEESE SOUP
info:
BROCCOLI AND CHEESE SOUP

ingredients

1 (10 oz.) pkg. chopped broccoli
1/2 c. grated carrots
1/2 c. chopped celery
1/2 c. chopped onion
3/4 stick oleo
1/4 c. flour
2 c. milk
1 lb. Velveeta cheese, cubed
pepper to taste

preparation

Combine vegetables in large saucepan and cook until tender. Melt oleo in medium saucepan; stir in flour until smooth. Add milk; stir constantly. When mixture becomes thick, add cheese and stir until melted. Add vegetables and pepper. Mix well. Heat thoroughly. If soup is too thick, add more milk.

title: 166. CHICKEN BARLEY SOUP
info:
CHICKEN BARLEY SOUP

ingredients

1 broiler-fryer chicken (2 to 3 lb.), cut up
2 qt. water
1 1/2 c. diced carrots
1 c. diced celery
1/2 c. barley
1/2 c. chopped onion
1 chicken bouillon cube
1 tsp. salt
1 bay leaf
1/2 tsp. poultry seasoning
1/2 tsp. pepper
1/2 tsp. dried sage

preparation

In large kettle, cook chicken in water until tender. Cook broth and skim off fat. Bone the chicken and cut into bite size pieces; return to kettle along with remaining ingredients. Simmer, covered, for at least 1 hour or until vegetables and barley are tender. Remove bay leaf. Makes about 1 1/2 quarts or about 5 servings.

title: 136. BRITISH LIGHT CARROT SOUP
info:
BRITISH LIGHT CARROT SOUP

ingredients

1/2 lb. carrots, chopped
1 large onion, chopped
1 stalk celery, chopped
1 Tbsp. butter
dash of ginger/cayenne (carefully)
2 1/2 c. chicken stock
1 1/4 c. milk
chopped parsley

preparation

Sauté onion and celery in butter. Add carrots and spices. Sauté a bit longer. Add stock. Simmer 25 minutes. Cool. Put in blender. Return to pot and add milk when reheating. Sprinkle with chopped parsley.

title: 162. WILD RICE CHICKEN SOUP
info:
WILD RICE CHICKEN SOUP

ingredients

1 large onion, chopped
1 large carrot, shredded
1 medium stalk celery, chopped
2 Tbsp. butter
1/2 c. all-purpose flour
8 c. fat-free chicken broth
3 c. cooked wild rice
6 oz. cooked boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cubed
1/4 tsp. table salt
1/4 tsp. black pepper
1 c. fat-free evaporated milk
1/4 c. chives (fresh), snipped

preparation

In a large saucepan, saut onion, carrot and celery in butter until tender. Spoon in flour and stir until blended, then add broth gradually. Stir in rice, chicken, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil over medium heat; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Stir in milk. Cook for 3 to 5 minutes more until heated through. Ladle into individual bowls. Garnish with chives and serve. Yields about 1 1/4 cups per serving.

title: 288. BROCCOLI CHEESE SOUP
info:
BROCCOLI CHEESE SOUP

ingredients

1 pkg. frozen chopped broccoli or about 3 C. fresh broccoli heads cooked in broth
2 cans chicken broth
1 med. onion chopped
3/4 stick margarine (6T)
1/2 c. flour
1 large can evaporated milk*
2 c. milk (may use low-fat or skim)*
1 tsp. paprika
1 lb. velveeta - (I used 8 slices Kraft low-fat singles with 1-1 1/2 c. shredded cheddar)
Salt/pepper to taste

preparation

Cook broccoli in chicken broth 15 min. Sauté onion in margarine until tender. Add flour and stir. Add milks and cook until thick. Add broccoli, broth, paprika and cheese. Stir until cheese melts. Turn to simmer for 30 min. stirring often.

NOTE: To thicken, add 2 Tbsp. cornstarch with 1 c. water.

title: 70. SPINACH SOUP
info:
SPINACH SOUP

ingredients

1 c. green onions, firmly chopped
6 Tbsp. margarine or butter
2 c. dry nondairy creamer
5 c. chicken broth
2 medium potatoes, thinly sliced
2 medium carrots, sliced
1/4 c. uncooked regular rice
1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen spinach

preparation

Cook onions in butter until soft. Add nondairy creamer all at once to boiling chicken broth and stir to blend. Add potatoes, carrots and rice to cooked onions; stir. Cover and cook 15 minutes; add to broth. Add frozen spinach and continue boiling for 15 minutes more, stirring often to prevent sticking. Salt and pepper to taste. Can be frozen and reheated.

title: 127. CREAM OF BROCCOLI SOUP
info:
CREAM OF BROCCOLI SOUP

ingredients

1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen broccoli, chopped
1 can cream of mushroom soup
1 1/2 c. milk
black pepper to taste
2 Tbsp. butter or margarine
tarragon (if desired)

preparation

Cook broccoli according to package directions; drain. Mix soup with milk; stir constantly while heating. Don't boil. Add broccoli, pepper to taste, butter and herb. Heat to bubbly and serve.

title: 228. OLD FASHION CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP
info:
OLD FASHION CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP

ingredients

3 chicken breasts
1/2 lb. fine noodles
carrots, chopped fine
onions (optional)
salt
pepper

preparation

Boil chicken until done. Take chicken apart; cut fine pieces. Take the rest of the ingredients into pan. Cook until carrots are done. Cover and simmer for at least 2 hours.

title: 64. SHE-CRAB SOUP
info:
SHE-CRAB SOUP

ingredients

1/4 lb. butter
1/2 c. flour
1/2 c. finely chopped celery
1/2 c. finely chopped carrots
1/2 c. finely chopped onions
1 pt. milk
1 c. chicken broth
1 Tbsp. Old Bay seasoning
1 lb. crab meat
1/3 c. dry sherry
1 pt. half and half

preparation

Combine butter and flour, cooking over low heat for 3 to 4 minutes. Sauté celery, carrots and onions. Heat milk and chicken broth together. Add butter, flour, seasoning, vegetables and crab meat. Simmer over low heat for about 30 minutes. Then add sherry and half and half. Simmer for another five minutes.

title: 104. SPLIT PEA SOUP
info:
SPLIT PEA SOUP

ingredients

12 c. water
1 c. brown rice
2 tsp. basil
2 c. split peas
2 tsp. sea salt
2 c. chopped onions or 2 Tbsp. onion powder
2 c. diced carrots (optional)
2 c. dried celery or 2 tsp. celery seed

preparation

Add rice and peas to boiling water. Lightly boil 1 1/2 hours. Add remaining ingredients and continue to cook about 30 minutes.

title: 278. CREAMY SWISS AND BROCCOLI SOUP
info:
CREAMY SWISS AND BROCCOLI SOUP

ingredients

1 c. chopped ham
1 c. water
1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen chopped broccoli
2 c. milk
3 Tbsp. flour
8 oz. natural Swiss cheese, cubed
1/2 tsp. salt
dash of pepper

preparation

Simmer ham and broccoli in water for 10 minutes or until broccoli is tender. Gradually add milk to flour, stirring until well blended. Gradually add milk mixture to ham mixture, stirring constantly until mixture slightly thickens. Simmer 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add cheese and seasonings. Cook until cheese begins to melt. Serves 4 to 6.

title: 129. POTATO SOUP
info:
POTATO SOUP

ingredients

4 c. peeled, cubed potatoes
1 c. sliced celery
1 c. coarsely chopped onion
2 tsp. salt
2 c. water
1 c. milk
1 c. whipping cream
3 Tbsp. butter or margarine, melted
1 Tbsp. dried parsley flakes
1/8 tsp. pepper

preparation

Cook potatoes, celery, onion and salt in 2 cups water about 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Stir in remaining ingredients. Lightly mash with a potato masher and cook, stirring constantly, until soup is hot and thickened.

title: 188. SOUP DELIGHT
info:
SOUP DELIGHT

ingredients

6 potatoes
3 onions, cook tender
1 lb. ground beef
1 can Chef Boyardee spaghetti and meatballs
1 can tomatoes
1 can corn
small bottle or 1 c. ketchup
1 stick butter

preparation

Cook potatoes and onion until tender; drain water. Fry hamburger meat and drain. Add together and simmer 20 minutes; serve hot.

title: 167. WILD RICE SOUP
info:
WILD RICE SOUP

ingredients

1/2 lb. bacon, fried and chopped
1 onion, chopped and fried
2 cans potato soup
2 cans water
1 pt. half and half or milk will work
1 Tbsp. chicken bouillon
1 c. rinsed and cooked wild rice
1 c. shredded Cheddar cheese

preparation

Add the soup, water, half and half and chicken bouillon to the bacon and onion. Heat. I like to add 2 tablespoons cornstarch mixed with 2 teaspoons water. Add to the above the rice and cheese. Mix, heat and serve. Can add turkey, chicken or ham.

title: 270. WEDDING SOUP
info:
WEDDING SOUP
(Minestra de Scarola)

ingredients

1 large head escarole
3 c. water
2 Tbsp. fresh parsley
1/4 c. freshly grated Romano cheese
1 c. freshly grated Parmesan cheese
1/4 lb. ground beef
1/8 lb. ground veal
1/8 lb. ground pork
1/4 tsp. salt
1/8 tsp. pepper
1/4 tsp. oregano
1/4 tsp. basil
1 egg
1/4 c. bread crumbs
4 qt. chicken, beef or holiday broth

preparation

Wash escarole under cold running water. Be sure to open the leaves to get out any hidden grit. Place a large size pot over medium-high heat. Add water and escarole and boil for 10 minutes or until done. Drain and allow to cool. When cool, chop into small pieces and set aside. While escarole is cooling, chop parsley into fine pieces and grate cheeses.

In a large mixing bowl, combine beef, veal, pork, parsley, cheeses, salt, pepper, oregano, basil, egg and bread crumbs. Mix well and shape into 1/4 to 1/2-inch balls. Place broth in 6-quart pot over medium-high heat and bring to a rolling boil. Add meatballs; cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Add escarole; lower heat and simmer an additional 10 minutes. Serve with additional freshly grated Parmesan cheese. Serves 10 to 12.

Note: If you want to add a small pastina, add 1/2 cup 2 or 3 minutes after adding meatballs.

title: 249. HAMBURGER SOUP
info:
HAMBURGER SOUP

ingredients

1 1/2 lb. ground beef
1 medium onion
1 (28 oz.) tomatoes
2 c. water
3 cans beef consomme
1 can tomato soup
4 carrots, chopped fine
3 stalks celery, chopped fine
1 bay leaf
1/2 tsp. thyme
8 Tbsp. barley

preparation

Brown meat and onion; drain well. Combine all ingredients and simmer, covered, for 2 to 4 hours.

I have substituted ground turkey and chicken broth and it is wonderful.

title: 258. DUTCH COUNTRY BEAN SOUP
info:
DUTCH COUNTRY BEAN SOUP

ingredients

1 lb. Northern beans, soaked overnight
ham bone
1/2 c. chopped onion
1 c. diced celery
salt and pepper
1 can tomato sauce
1/2 c. diced potatoes
2 tsp. parsley

preparation

Drain beans; add fresh water and cook slowly with ham bone for 2 hours. Put in onion, celery, potatoes, tomato sauce, parsley, salt and pepper and simmer until vegetables are soft. Remove ham bone; trim off all meat and add to soup.

title: 240. TOMATO RICE SOUP
info:
TOMATO RICE SOUP

ingredients

1/4 c. margarine
1 tsp. minced garlic
1/4 c. flour
1 1/2 c. nonfat dry milk
1/4 c. tomato paste
1 tsp. dried basil
3/4 c. chopped white onion
1/4 c. chopped green onion
4 c. chicken stock
1 (9 oz.) can tomatoes, diced (undrained)
1 1/2 c. cooked rice

preparation

In a large saucepan, melt margarine over medium heat. Sauté onions and garlic until onions are soft. Off heat, stir in flour to make a roux. Return to heat and stir for about 5 minutes.

Meanwhile, heat chicken stock. Gradually combine nonfat dry milk with warm stock, stirring well to dissolve lumps. Slowly add to roux, stirring constantly to avoid lumping. Continue until all liquid is well combined, smooth and begins to thicken. Add tomatoes, tomato paste, basil and rice. Simmer about 15 minutes. Makes 8 servings.

title: 177. CHEESE SOUP
info:
CHEESE SOUP

ingredients

3 (15 oz.) cans chicken broth or 6 chicken-flavored bouillon cubes and 45 oz. water
2 bags frozen vegetables (any style; mixed is good)
1 can Ro-Tel tomatoes with green chilies
10 oz. Mexican Velveeta cheese

preparation

Boil until vegetables are tender. Cut cheese in 10 (1-ounce) slices and add to vegetable mixture until cheese is melted.

Note: Can also add fresh vegetables such as carrots, cabbage and onion. If you don't like spicy, just use regular Ro-Tel tomatoes and light or plain Velveeta.

title: 18. DUCK SOUP
info:
DUCK SOUP

ingredients

1 duck, cut up and rinsed
1/2 to 1 lb. prunes and/or raisins
4 cloves
5 allspice
1 bay leaf
1/2 tsp. marjoram
salt to taste
duck blood
1/2 c. flour
1/4 c. sugar
1/2 c. vinegar

preparation

Put duck in large soup pot; cover with cold water and bring to a boil. Turn down heat and skim. Simmer 1 1/2 hours with prunes, cloves, allspice, bay leaf, marjoram and salt. When duck is tender, add blood. Thicken soup with flour; flavor with sugar and vinegar. Serve with potato noodles.

title: 269. ITALIAN WEDDING SOUP
info:
ITALIAN WEDDING SOUP

ingredients

8 c. homemade chicken broth
3/4 lb. ground beef
3/4 lb. ground pork
3 eggs plus 5 eggs
1 c. dry bread crumbs
2 tsp. dried basil
1 tsp. dried parsley
1/2 c. grated Parmesan plus 1 c.
2 medium heads escarole, cleaned and chopped

preparation

In a separate pot over medium heat, bring broth to a boil. In separate large bowl, combine the beef, pork, 3 eggs, bread crumbs, basil, parsley and 1/2 cup Parmesan. Mix well and form into bite size balls. Drop the balls into the broth. Add escarole into broth. When balls rise to the top, they are cooked, about 5 to 7 minutes. When escarole is wilted, it is done. In a separate bowl, combine the remaining 5 eggs with the remaining cheese. Pour this mixture into soup, stirring continuously until the egg is cooked.

title: 203. TRAMP SOUP
info:
TRAMP SOUP

ingredients

1 medium onion, cut fine
4 potatoes, cubed
1 lb. sausage, cut up
1 qt. milk

preparation

Put together in pan with a little water and salt. Cook until well done. Add milk; bring to a boil. Serve with crackers.

title: 284. CREAMY CHICKEN SOUP
info:
CREAMY CHICKEN SOUP

ingredients

5 c. chicken broth
4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cubed
3 c. frozen mixed vegetables
1 tsp. curry powder
1/2 tsp. crushed dried thyme
2 c. milk
1/3 c. all-purpose flour
1 green onion, thinly sliced
salt and pepper to taste

preparation

In a large saucepan, combine chicken broth, chicken, frozen vegetables, curry and thyme. Bring mixture to boil; reduce heat and simmer 1 hour. Whisk together milk and flour until flour is dissolved; stir into soup. Cook and stir until mixture thickens, then simmer 2 minutes more. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Ladle into bowls and sprinkle green onion slices on top.

title: 138. BROCCOLI CHEESE SOUP
info:
BROCCOLI CHEESE SOUP

ingredients

2 boxes frozen broccoli, chopped
2 lb. Velveeta
2 cans chicken broth
6 oz. fine egg noodles
6 c. half and half
3/4 c. chopped onion
1 Tbsp. butter
garlic powder
pepper

preparation

Cook broccoli as directed. Add garlic powder. In large pot, melt butter and sauté onions until tender. Add 2 cans of chicken broth and boil. Cook noodles in broth. Add broccoli with juices, then cheese and half and half. Lower heat and cook until melted. Salt and pepper to taste.

title: 224. FRENCH ONION SOUP
info:
FRENCH ONION SOUP

ingredients

1/2 c. butter
4 c. beef stock
2 c. onions, sliced
1 tsp. salt
1/8 tsp. pepper
1 tsp. parsley
2 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce

preparation

Sauté onions in butter; add beef stock, salt, pepper and Worcestershire sauce. Cover and simmer 45 minutes.

title: 68. RUSSIAN MUSHROOM AND POTATO SOUP
info:
RUSSIAN MUSHROOM AND POTATO SOUP

ingredients

2 leeks or onions, chopped
2 large carrots, chopped
5 Tbsp. butter or oleo, divided
6 c. chicken broth
2 tsp. dill weed
2 tsp. salt
dash of pepper
1 bay leaf
5 c. potatoes, diced
1 lb. fresh mushrooms, sliced
2 Tbsp. flour
1 c. half and half or cream

preparation

Sauté onions and carrots in 3 tablespoons butter. Stir in chicken broth, seasonings and potatoes; simmer 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Remove the bay leaf. In skillet sauté mushrooms in remaining butter 5 minutes. Stir in flour and cream. Add to soup and bring to boil.

title: 242. TURKEY TORTILLA SOUP
info:
TURKEY TORTILLA SOUP
(Serves 8)

ingredients

1 c. onion, chopped
1 tsp. olive oil
1 (4 oz.) can chopped green chilies
1 (1 1/4 oz.) pkg. taco seasoning mix
1 (16 oz.) can tomatoes (undrained)
6 c. turkey broth or reduced-sodium chicken bouillon
1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen corn
2 c. cooked turkey, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
1/2 c. fresh cilantro, chopped
4 oz. unsalted tortilla chips, broken into pieces
1/2 c. Monterey Jack cheese, grated

preparation

In 5-quart saucepan over medium heat, sauté onion in oil 3 to 4 minutes or until translucent. Stir in chilies and taco seasoning mix. Cook 1 minute. Add tomatoes, breaking up with a spoon. Stir in turkey broth; bring to a boil. Add corn and turkey; reduce heat to low and simmer 5 minutes. Add cilantro.

To serve, spoon 1 1/3 cups soup in each bowl. Top each serving with 1/2 ounce tortilla pieces and 1 tablespoon cheese.

title: 217. CROCK POT VEGETABLE SOUP
info:
CROCK POT VEGETABLE SOUP

ingredients

1 - 1 lb can of tomatoes, cut up
1 lb Beef short ribs
2 qts Water
1 tsp salt
2 tsp celery salt
1 small onion (chopped)
1 cup carrots (diced)
1/2 cup celery (diced)
2 cups of potatoes (diced)
1 medium turnip (peeled and finely chopped)
1 small pkg frozen corn (10 ounce)
1 small pkg frozen green beans (10 ounce)
1 small pkg frozen peas (10 ounce)

preparation

THIS NEEDS A 6 QUART OR LARGER CROCK POT.

Place meat, water, tomatoes, salt, celery salt, onion, carrots and celery in the crock pot. Cover and cook on low 4 to 6 hours. Remove bones and chop meat and return to crock pot. Add potatoes, corn, peas, green beans and turnips. Cover and cook on high for 2 to 3 hours. Makes 8 to 10 servings.

title: 100. ONION SOUP
info:
ONION SOUP

ingredients

4 large onions, thinly sliced
2 Tbsp. margarine
4 1/2 c. beef broth
1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/2 tsp. salt
1/8 tsp. pepper
2 slices French bread, toasted
2 Tbsp. grated Parmesan cheese

preparation

Sauté onions in margarine until lightly browned. Add broth, Worcestershire sauce, salt and pepper. Simmer 20 minutes. Sprinkle toast with Parmesan cheese, place under broiler a few seconds until cheese is browned. Cut each slice into 3 pieces. Pour soup in bowls and float toast slices on top.

title: 37. COUNTRY VEGETABLE SOUP
info:
COUNTRY VEGETABLE SOUP

ingredients

3 Tbsp. olive oil
2 stalks celery, chopped
1 medium carrot, peeled and sliced
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 small yellow onion, chopped
2 (15 oz.) cans Great Northern or pinto beans
1 Tbsp. Kitchen Bouquet
1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen chopped spinach
1 c. potato, diced
1 small bay leaf
2 (14 oz.) cans chicken broth
1 c. cabbage, shredded
1 c. zucchini, sliced
1/4 tsp. thyme
1 (8 oz.) can tomato sauce

preparation

In large heavy bottom pot, heat oil. Sauté celery, carrot, garlic and onion over medium heat until tender (about 15 minutes). Add beans. Add remaining ingredients and simmer 1 hour. May serve sprinkled with Parmesan cheese. Serves 6.

title: 86. CORNED BEEF SOUP
info:
CORNED BEEF SOUP

ingredients

1 (10 oz.) pkg. fordhook lima beans
2 (15 oz.) cans tomatoes
3 medium potatoes, peeled and cut up into 1-inch sq.
1 large onion, peeled and cut up
3 carrots, peeled and sliced or diced
1 can corned beef
water (to desired consistency)
salt and pepper to taste
1 can whole kernel corn

preparation

In a large pot boil fordhooks until almost done. Add tomatoes and return to boil. Add potatoes, onion and carrots and boil gently until vegetables are nearly done. Add corned beef. Add water along with salt and pepper to desired consistency and taste. Simmer over low heat, adding corn about 15 minutes before serving.

title: 179. TORTILLA CHEESE SOUP
info:
TORTILLA CHEESE SOUP

ingredients

1 can Campbell's fiesta cheese soup
1 can Campbell's cream of chicken soup
1 can medium enchilada sauce
2 c. milk
1 (4 oz.) can mild diced green chilies
1 lb. diced, cooked chicken
shredded Cheddar cheese, sour cream and broken tortilla chips (garnish)

preparation

Mix all ingredients together. Heat on the stove with a double boiler to avoid scorching or heat in a microwave, stirring every 1 to 2 minutes. Serve in bowls. Garnish with shredded cheese, broken chips and sour cream, if desired.

title: 227. FILLED PEPPER SOUP
info:
FILLED PEPPER SOUP

ingredients

2 lb. ground beef
1 (28 oz.) can tomatoes
1 (28 oz.) can tomato sauce
2 c. rice, cooked
2 to 3 c. green pepper chunks
2 beef bouillon cubes
1/4 c. brown sugar
1 1/2 tsp. salt
1/4 tsp. pepper

preparation

Combine all after browning hamburg in large pot. Simmer at least 1 hour, stirring often.

title: 189. TACO SOUP
info:
TACO SOUP

ingredients

1 lb. ground round
1 large onion, chopped
1 can green chilies, chopped
1 pkg. taco seasoning
1 pkg. Hidden Valley Ranch
1 can pinto or chili beans
1 can corn
1 can tomatoes
2 cans Ro-Tel tomatoes

preparation

Cook beef and onions; drain. Simmer other ingredients while beef cooks. Mix all together and simmer. Add a little water if needed. Cook for 30 minutes. Serve with sour cream, corn chips and cheese or Mexican cornbread. Serves 6 (1 1/2 cups).

title: 92. SAVORY PORK SOUP
info:
SAVORY PORK SOUP

ingredients

2 lb. boneless pork shoulder
1/4 c. flour
1/4 c. oil
1 medium onion, diced
2 (16 oz.) cans tomatoes
4 bouillon cubes
4 c. water
1 (6 oz.) can vegetable juice cocktail
3 stalks celery, sliced
2 c. carrots, sliced
1 bay leaf
1 Tbsp. parsley flakes
1/2 tsp. pepper
1 tsp. salt

preparation

Cut pork into 1-inch cubes. Dredge cubes in flour and brown in oil in large skillet. Add onion and cook for one minute, stirring constantly. Add remaining ingredients; bring to boil and simmer 1 to 1 1/2 hours.

title: 295. HOMEMADE VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP
info:
HOMEMADE VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP

ingredients

3 lb. chuck roast
beef suet (if roast is lean)
4 carrots
4 ham hocks with bone
2 1/2 lb. red potatoes, finely cubed (about 2 1/2 cups cooked)
1 lb. sliced okra (frozen or fresh, but thaw if frozen)
2 Tbsp. vegetable oil
3 cans (28 oz. each) whole tomatoes
2 c. onions, coarsely chopped
4 large sections garlic, minced
1 Tbsp. salt
1 tsp. ground black pepper
baby lima beans
speckled butter beans
green beans
purple hull peas
whole kernel corn

preparation

Clean and cut carrots crosswise in 2 inch pieces; place in 5 quart cooking pan. Wash roast, cut up in large pieces, season with salt, ground black pepper and garlic salt. Transfer meat to 5 quart pan with carrots; add water to top of meat. Cook covered for 2 hours or longer until very tender. OR, cook in pressurized cooker (i.e., Presto cooker) with water up to top of meat for 40 minutes. Remove meat to large bowl or rectangular pan, reserving broth. Discard suet. Trim fat from meat and cut into small pieces. Remove carrots to a small bowl. Set meat and carrots aside. Strain beef broth into separate bowl, add water, if necessary, to make 2 cups; set broth aside.

While beef is cooking, cook vegetables (except corn) separately on cook top, each with a ham hock, as directed on package if frozen (season with salt). OR, when meat is done, cook each vegetable (except corn) with a ham hock and salt in Presto cooker for 12 minutes each. Transfer each vegetable to a separate small bowl. Separate meat from ham hocks and place in a small bowl; discard bones and fat and skin. Season corn with butter and salt; cook in microwave or stovetop per package directions...fresh corn is great.

Pour cubed raw potatoes in a 3 quart pan; add water to top of potatoes and cook until done. Set aside.

Fry okra in vegetable oil until light tan. Pour into small bowl and set aside.

Coarsely chop tomatoes and pour into a 5 quart stockpot; add chopped onions, garlic and okra. Cook on medium heat, for about 1 1/2 hours. Stir in broth, add vegetables to measure 1 cup each (add corn last, as it sticks easily), add 2 1/2 cups potatoes, beef and ham hock meats.

Slice carrots into soup mixture. Add salt and pepper; adjust seasoning to taste. Cook for about 30 minutes; stir in 1 cup corn. Reserve leftover vegetables for another use.

title: 20. HOMEMADE CHICKEN SOUP
info:
HOMEMADE CHICKEN SOUP

ingredients

1 whole chicken
2 stalks celery
dash of salt
dash of pepper
1 can corn
4 eggs
dash of salt
4 c. flour

preparation

Cut chicken into pieces and put into big soup pot. Add celery, salt and pepper. Cover with water. Put on lid. Simmer until chicken falls off bones. Drain broth. Debone chicken. Discard bones and celery. Add chicken and corn into broth. Bring to a boil.

In medium bowl, beat eggs and add a dash of salt. Add flour to eggs until flour is gone. Drop by spoonful into boiling broth. Serves a family of 6. Eat and enjoy!

title: 142. STONE SOUP
info:
STONE SOUP

ingredients

1 qt. water
2 c. potatoes, cubed
1 c. onion, chopped
1/2 c. celery, chopped
4 bouillon cubes (chicken)
2 cans celery soup
1 can Veg-All, drained
1 lb. Velveeta cheese

preparation

Cook the first 5 ingredients until tender. Then add celery soup, Veg-All and cheese. Simmer until cheese melts.

title: 119. BROCCOLI CHEESE SOUP
info:
BROCCOLI CHEESE SOUP

ingredients

2 Tbsp. margarine
3/4 c. onion, chopped
6 chicken bouillon cubes
3 c. water
1 (8 oz.) pkg. egg noodles
2 (10 oz.) pkg. broccoli
3 c. milk
1/2 tsp. garlic powder
1 lb. Velveeta cheese
8 oz. sauteed mushrooms
1 1/2 c. chopped cooked chicken

preparation

Sauté onions and mushrooms in margarine; add water and bouillon cubes. Heat to boiling and cubes dissolve. Add noodles and boil, uncovered, 3 minutes. Stir in broccoli, garlic powder and chicken. Add cubed cheese and cook until melted, but do not boil. Add milk and cook until hot.

Freezes well and may be reheated by adding a small amount of milk.

title: 117. HEARTY POTATO SOUP
info:
HEARTY POTATO SOUP

ingredients

6 medium potatoes, peeled and sliced
2 carrots, diced
6 stalks celery, diced
2 qt. water
1 onion, chopped
6 Tbsp. margarine
1 tsp. salt
1/2 tsp. pepper
1 1/2 c. milk

preparation

In a large kettle, cook potatoes, carrots and celery in water until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain, reserving liquid and setting vegetables aside. In the same kettle, sauté onion in butter until soft. Stir in flour, salt and pepper; gradually add milk, stirring constantly, until thickened. Gently stir in cooked vegetables. Add 1 cup or more of reserved cooking liquid until soup is desired consistency.

title: 153. CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP
info:
CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP

ingredients

1 1/2 c. cubed cooked chicken
1 c. sliced carrots
1/2 c. chopped celery
1/2 c. chopped onion
1 parsnip, peeled and cubed
2 tsp. chopped parsley
1 tsp. chopped dill
4 (14 1/2 oz.) cans chicken broth
3 1/2 oz. (2 c.) uncooked wide egg noodles

preparation

In stockpot, combine all ingredients, except noodles. Mix well. Cook over medium heat for 20 minutes or until vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally. Add noodles. Simmer an additional 15 minutes or until desired doneness.

title: 281. CONFETTI BEAN SOUP
info:
CONFETTI BEAN SOUP

ingredients

1 pkg. (16-oz.) 14 varieties dried bean soup mix
4 beef-flavor bouillon cubes
2 lb. smoked ham hocks
3 Tbsp. chopped chives
1 tsp. salt
1 tsp. dried Summer Savory
1 tsp. ground cumin
1/2 tsp. lemon pepper
1 bay leaf
1 16-oz. can stewed tomatoes with liquid

preparation

Rinse beans with running cold water and discard any stones or shriveled beans. In a 5-quart Dutch oven over high heat, heat beans and 9 cups water to boiling; cook 3 minutes. Remove from heat; cover and let stand 1 hour. Drain and rinse beans. Return beans to Dutch oven; add next 8 ingredients and 8 cups of water. Over high heat, heat to boiling; reduce heat to low, cover and simmer 2 hours or until beans are tender, stirring occasionally. Remove ham hocks; cut meat into small pieces and return to soup. Add the can of tomatoes with its liquid; over high heat, heat to boiling. Reduce heat to low; cook, uncovered, 1 hour longer, stirring to break up tomatoes. Discard bay leaf. Serves 10-12.

title: 204. CHICKEN SOUP
info:
CHICKEN SOUP

ingredients

3 qt. water
1 fryer chicken
2 medium potatoes
1 medium onion
2 bay leaves
3 carrots
3 celery stalks (optional)
chicken bouillon cube (optional)

preparation

Boil (slowly) chicken in the water for 40 to 45 minutes. Remove chicken from water. Set aside on platter to cool. Skim top of the water and discard skimmings. Add vegetables to water (can be cut first if you wish) and bouillon cube. When the chicken has cooled, remove meat from bone and put back in water to simmer for 2 more hours.

title: 184. OYSTER SOUP
info:
OYSTER SOUP

ingredients

2 Tbsp. oil
2 Tbsp. flour
1 large onion, chopped
1/3 c. onion tops
2 Tbsp. parsley
1 pt. oysters (with water)
angel hair spaghetti
salt and pepper

preparation

Heat oil and brown flour to make roux. Add finely chopped onion and onion tops. Cook until onions begin to melt. Add 1/2 of water; cover and cook 10 minutes or until onions are soft. Add oysters, parsley, salt and pepper; cook and add remaining water or more if you like lots of juice. Add spaghetti and cook 3 to 5 minutes. Serve.

title: 90. CHICKEN SOUP CHINESE STYLE
info:
CHICKEN SOUP CHINESE STYLE

ingredients

4 or 5 green onions
5 c. strongly flavored clear basic chicken stock
6 small mushrooms, finely sliced
2 c. shredded white chicken meat
2 beaten eggs
salt and pepper to taste
2 to 3 tsp. soy sauce

preparation

Finely slice white part of onions. Reserve green parts for garnish. Heat stock until boiling. Add mushrooms and onions. Cook 2 to 3 minutes. Add chicken. Beat eggs with a little salt and pepper until frothy. Stir soup well. Pour eggs steadily into soup, stirring constantly, so that it remains in shreds. Let cook a minute or two to set eggs. Add soy sauce to taste. Serve in soup bowls. Sprinkle with finely chopped green parts of onions. Yields 4 to 6 servings.

title: 289. CHICKEN HARVEST SOUP
info:
CHICKEN HARVEST SOUP

ingredients

1 1/2 sticks butter
3/4 c. flour
2 qts. Milk
10 to 12 chicken bouillon cubes or chicken base
1 c. sliced baby carrots
1 c. sliced celery
1/3 c. diced yellow onion
1 tbsp. white pepper
3 Tbsp. onion powder
1 Tbsp. paprika
1 tsp. red pepper
3 lbs. raw chicken tenders, diced
6 oz. wide egg noodles

preparation

Melt butter in small saucepan. Add flour and cook on low to create roux. Add more flour to get the pasty consistency. Cook just enough to remove the raw flour taste. Heat milk and bouillon cubes in double boiler until a "skin" of tiny surface bubbles forms on top. Stir occasionally. Whip in the roux a little at a time until desired thickness. If you run out of roux before achieving desired thickness, make more and add accordingly. This is the time to get the soup texture right. If you wait to thicken, the soup will be lumpy and the noodles broken. Remove from heat after thickening. Move to another burner and add vegetables, spices and chicken. Stir well. Add raw noodles last. Cook on low for 10 minutes, then turn off stove. Let soup sit for 30 minutes as chicken and noodles finish cooking. Stir gently with a wide spatula to avoid breaking the noodles. If the starch in the noodles renders the soup too thick, thin with milk or half-and-half. Reheat and serve with hot yeast rolls. Recipe can be halved.

title: 121. BLACK BEAN AND CHICKEN SOUP
info:
BLACK BEAN AND CHICKEN SOUP

ingredients

1/2 c. dried black beans
2 c. water
1 bay leaf
2 Tbsp. olive oil
1/2 c. peeled and chopped broccoli stems
1/2 c. cubed carrot
1 c. cubed celery
1 c. chopped onion
1 Tbsp. thyme
1 Tbsp. basil
1/2 c. dry white wine
8 oz. boneless, skinless chicken breast
4 Tbsp. barbecue sauce
1 c. chicken broth
12 oz. skim milk
2 c. broccoli florets
1 Tbsp. cornstarch, dissolved in 2 Tbsp. cold water
1 Tbsp. liquid smoke
1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
1 tsp. Tabasco sauce
1/4 c. chopped fresh cilantro

preparation

Rinse beans. Put them into a large bowl and cover completely with cold water. Let stand overnight! Drain beans. Transfer to a medium pan. Add 2 cups water and bay leaf. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook 15 minutes. Reduce heat. Simmer for 20 minutes, until beans are tender. Drain and discard the bay leaf.

Preheat oven to 400°. Place a heavy pot over medium heat for 1 minute. Put olive oil and add the stems, carrots, celery and onions. Cover and reduce heat to low. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add thyme, basil and wine. Simmer for 15 minutes. Coat chicken with barbecue sauce and bake 10 minutes on top oven rack. Remove from oven and cube chicken. Add chicken stock, chicken and beans to stockpot. Cook over low heat for 3 minutes, until thoroughly heated. Stir in skim milk and broccoli florets. Cook 5 minutes. Do not boil. Add cornstarch mixture and cook a few minutes longer. Add liquid smoke, Worcestershire sauce and Tabasco sauce. Garnish with cilantro.

title: 126. CREAMY SWISS AND BROCCOLI SOUP
info:
CREAMY SWISS AND BROCCOLI SOUP

ingredients

1 c. chopped ham
1 c. water
1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen chopped broccoli
2 c. milk
3 Tbsp. flour
2 c. (8 oz.) natural Swiss cheese, cubed
1/2 tsp. salt
dash of pepper

preparation

Boil ham in water for 10 minutes; add broccoli. Cook until tender. Gradually add milk to flour, stirring until well blended. Gradually add milk mixture to ham mixture, stirring constantly until mixture slightly thickens. Simmer 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add cheese and seasonings. Cook until cheese begins to melt. Serves 4 to 6.

title: 157. THICK, CREAMY POTATO SOUP
info:
THICK, CREAMY POTATO SOUP

ingredients

8 tsp. chicken bouillon granules
8 c. water
4 to 5 stalks celery, chopped thinly
1 medium onion, chopped
6 to 8 potatoes, chopped or 1 bag frozen hash browns
1 c. milk
1/2 c. flour
1/4 c. milk
6 to 8 slices bacon, crumbled or 1/2 can
1 c. shredded cheese
3 green onions, chopped

preparation

In large stock pan, add bouillon granules and water. Bring to a slow boil. Add celery, onion and potatoes. Let cook until vegetables are tender (approximately 20 minutes). Add 1 cup of milk. In a separate bowl, mix together flour and 1/4 cup milk; should be smooth. Slowly mix flour mixture into soup, continually stirring. Add bacon to soup.

When serving soup, garnish with a spoon of cheese and green onion. Serves 8 to 10.

title: 47. CREAM OF CASHEW SOUP
info:
CREAM OF CASHEW SOUP

ingredients

1 medium onion, finely chopped
1/2 c. chopped celery or green pepper
1/2 tsp. ground cumin seed
1 Tbsp. oil
1 Tbsp. whole wheat flour
2 c. vegetable stock
1 c. skim milk
1 c. lightly toasted cashews
dash of hot sauce (optional)
1 tsp. salt
generous grind of fresh black pepper
1/2 c. fresh or frozen peas
1/4 c. thinly sliced scallions

preparation

Sauté onion, celery or green pepper and cumin seed in oil until tender. Stir in flour and sauté briefly. Add vegetable stock and cook, stirring, until it thickens slightly. Add milk.

Place cashews in blender and pour in 2 cups of soup. Blend quite thoroughly, adding hot sauce (if desired) and salt and pepper. Return to pan and heat, adding peas and scallions. Makes 1 quart of soup.

title: 290. CHICKEN TACO SOUP
info:
CHICKEN TACO SOUP

ingredients

1 lb. chicken breasts, boned and skinned
2 Tbsp. Olive oil
1 pkg. Taco seasoning mix
1 onion, finely chopped
1 clove garlic, minced
1 (15 oz.) can stewed tomatoes
1 (4 oz.) can green chilies, chopped
2 c. water
1 (8 oz.) can or jar mild green chili salsa
1 (15 oz.) can black beans
1 (15 oz.) can pinto beans
1 (15 oz.) can Mexican style stewed tomatoes

preparation

Season chicken to taste and broil in oven until done. Remove meat; cool and shred with a fork. (Chicken may be covered with water and boiled on stove until done if preferred. Remove from water; cool and shred with a fork.) In a large skillet, combine shredded chicken, olive oil, taco seasoning, onions, and garlic. Cook until onions are clear. While cooking chicken mixture, combine all the remaining ingredients in a pot and heat. When skillet mixture is done, add to the pot and heat thoroughly. Serve soup with cheese and chips or corn bread.

title: 144. LOW-FAT TACO SOUP
info:
LOW-FAT TACO SOUP

ingredients

1 lb. lean ground round beef
1 small onion, chopped
1 (4 oz.) can chopped green chiles
1 pkg. taco seasoning
1 pkg. Ranch dressing mix
1 can corn (with juice)
3 cans crushed tomatoes
1 c. pinto beans with juice
1 1/2 c. water

preparation

Brown the ground round beef. Drain and rinse beef with hot water to remove grease. Add browned beef to all remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Serve with tortilla chips.

title: 149. CHEESEBURGER SOUP
info:
CHEESEBURGER SOUP

ingredients

1/2 lb. ground beef
3/4 c. onion, chopped
3/4 c. carrots, shredded
3/4 c. celery, diced
1 tsp. dried basil
1 tsp. dried parsley leaves
4 Tbsp. butter or margarine, divided
3 c. chicken broth
4 c. (1 3/4 lb.) potatoes, peeled and diced
1/4 c. all-purpose flour
1 (8 oz.) pkg. process American cheese, cubed (2 cups)
1 1/2 c. milk
3/4 tsp. salt
1/4 to 1/2 tsp. pepper
1/4 c. sour cream

preparation

In a 3-quart saucepan, brown beef; drain and set aside. In the same saucepan, sauté onions, carrots, celery, basil and parsley in 1-tablespoon butter until vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes. Add broth, potatoes and beef; bring to boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer 10 - 12 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Meanwhile, in a small skillet, melt remaining butter. Add flour; cook and stir 3 - 5 minutes or until bubbly. Add to soup and bring to boil. Cook and stir 2 minutes. Reduce heat to low. Add cheese, milk, salt and pepper, cook and stir until cheese melts. Remove from heat; blend in sour cream. Yields 8 servings (2 1/4 quarts).

title: 222. ENCHILADA CHICKEN SOUP
info:
ENCHILADA CHICKEN SOUP

ingredients

1 (11 oz.) can condensed fiesta nacho cheese soup (undiluted)
1 (10 3/4 oz.) can condensed cream of chicken soup (undiluted)
2 2/3 c. milk
1 (10 oz.) can chunk white chicken, drained
1 (10 oz.) can enchilada sauce
1 (4 oz.) can chopped green chilies
sour cream
nacho chips

preparation

In a large saucepan, combine the soups, milk, chicken, enchilada sauce and chilies; mix well. Cook until heated through. Garnish with sour cream and nacho chips.

title: 84. TACO BEEF SOUP
info:
TACO BEEF SOUP

ingredients

3/4 lb. ground beef
1/4 c. chopped onion
1 1/2 c. water
1 (16 oz.) can stewed tomatoes, cut up
1 (16 oz.) can chili beans
1 (8 oz.) can tomato sauce
1/2 envelope (2 Tbsp.) taco seasoning mix
avocado, chopped
shredded Cheddar cheese
corn chips
sour cream

preparation

In large saucepan cook ground beef and onion until meat is browned. Drain off excess fat. Add water, undrained tomatoes, undrained beans, tomato sauce and taco seasoning mix. Simmer, covered, 15 to 20 minutes. Serve. Add avocado, cheese, corn chips and sour cream to top of each serving.

title: 161. WILLIDEAN'S POTATO SOUP
info:
WILLIDEAN'S POTATO SOUP

ingredients

6 large potatoes, chopped
1 onion, chopped
1 c. celery, chopped
salt and pepper to taste
1 can cream of mushroom soup
1 can cream of celery soup
1 1/2 c. milk
1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese

preparation

Cover potatoes, onion and celery with water and cook until tender. Add the cream of mushroom soup, celery soup, milk and cream cheese. Simmer until heated to serving temperature.

title: 67. CREAM OF AVOCADO SOUP
info:
CREAM OF AVOCADO SOUP
(Cool, Simple and Elegant)

ingredients

2 avocados, peeled, seeded and cubed
1 (13 oz.) can evaporated milk*
2 c. milk
1 c. chicken broth*
1/2 tsp. celery salt
1/2 tsp. garlic powder
1/4 tsp. salt
1/8 tsp. white pepper
watercress or parsley

preparation

*Use more chicken broth, if desired, and less evaporated milk.

Combine first 8 ingredients in a blender until smooth. If blender is not available, combine the avocado and evaporated milk and mix until smooth. Add remaining ingredients; mix until smooth. Chill thoroughly before serving with a garnish of watercress or parsley, if desired. Makes 4 to 6 servings. Looks beautiful served in glass bowls nestled in crushed ice.

title: 62. POTATO SAUERKRAUT SOUP
info:
POTATO SAUERKRAUT SOUP

ingredients

4 c. chicken broth
3/4 lb. Polish sausage, cubed
1 (10 3/4 oz.) can cream of mushroom soup
1 (16 oz.) can sauerkraut, rinsed and drained
8 oz. fresh mushrooms
1 onion, chopped
1 medium potato, cubed
2 carrots, chopped
2 stalks celery, chopped
1/2 c. cubed, cooked chicken
2 Tbsp. vinegar
1/2 tsp. pepper
2 tsp. dill weed
2 slices bacon, cooked crisp and crumbled
2 boiled eggs, cubed

preparation

In a 4-quart electric crock-pot, stir together first 13 ingredients. Cover and cook on low heat for 10 to 12 hours. If necessary, skim off fat before serving. Sprinkle each serving with bacon and eggs. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

title: 198. SUNDAY NIGHT SOUP
info:
SUNDAY NIGHT SOUP

ingredients

1 lb. ground chuck
1 onion, chopped
1 (6 oz.) can tomato paste
1 (11 oz.) can zesty tomato soup
2 c. water
2 (16 oz.) pkg. frozen mixed vegetables
2 beef bouillon cubes

preparation

Brown ground chuck and drain. Stir in onion; sauté until soft. Add remaining ingredients; simmer 30 minutes.

title: 244. POTATO SOUP
info:
POTATO SOUP
(Microwave)

ingredients

3 medium potatoes (1 lb.), peeled and diced
1/2 c. finely chopped onion
1/2 c. water
2 Tbsp. flour
2 c. skim milk
1/2 tsp. salt
1/4 tsp. black pepper
1 Tbsp. margarine
1 tsp. parsley leaves

preparation

Combine potatoes, onions and water in a 2-quart microwave-safe dish. Cook, covered, on full power, 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Stir one time. Lightly mash potatoes. Stir in flour. Add milk, salt and pepper. Cover and cook on full power 5 minutes longer, stirring every minute or until soup boils and is thickened.

Just before serving, add the tablespoon of margarine and the parsley. Makes 5 servings.

Tips: Serve with 1/2 tuna salad sandwich on whole wheat toast with lettuce and tomatoes.

title: 193. BROCCOLI CHEESE SOUP
info:
BROCCOLI CHEESE SOUP

ingredients

1 small pkg. frozen chopped broccoli
1 small onion, chopped
1 can chicken broth
3 Tbsp. butter
1/4 c. flour
2 c. milk
3/4 c. Velveeta cheese
salt and pepper to taste

preparation

In a sauce pan, cook (uncovered) broccoli and onions in chicken broth for 8 to 10 minutes. In another sauce pan, melt butter and add flour gradually. Add milk and stir with a wire whisk. Add broccoli and broth mixture to cheese sauce. Simmer on low for 5 to 10 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste.

title: 24. CRAB SOUP
info:
CRAB SOUP

ingredients

2 Tbsp. butter
1/2 c. diced celery
1/2 c. diced carrots
1 leek, diced
1 green pepper, diced
1 onion, diced
1 qt. chicken broth
2 tomatoes, peeled and diced
1/2 tsp. saffron
1 can king crabmeat
1 Tbsp. cooked rice

preparation

Melt butter. Add celery, carrots, leek, green pepper, onion and 1 cup of broth. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add tomatoes. In separate pan, heat remaining broth with saffron to boiling point. Strain saffron and chicken broth mixture into first mixture. Cook for 30 minutes. Add crabmeat and rice. Serve with crackers.

title: 99. VEGETABLE SOUP
info:
VEGETABLE SOUP

ingredients

1 c. meat stock or bouillon cube
1/2 c. mixed vegetables with carrots and peas
1/2 small onion, chopped
1/4 c. cabbage, shredded
1 stalk celery, diced
1/4 c. tomato juice
salt and pepper

preparation

Prepare vegetables and add to broth. Boil together until vegetables are just tender for 20 minutes. Makes 4 servings, each 1 cup.

title: 57. CAULIFLOWER SOUP
info:
CAULIFLOWER SOUP

ingredients

2 c. chopped celery
3/4 c. onion slices
6 Tbsp. margarine
1/3 c. flour
1/2 tsp. salt
1/4 tsp. pepper
4 1/2 c. chicken broth
3 c. milk
3 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen cauliflower, cooked, drained and chopped
2 c. shredded Monterey Jack cheese

preparation

Sauté celery and onions in margarine. Blend in flour and seasonings. Gradually add broth and milk. Cook, stirring constantly until thickened. Add cauliflower and cheese. Simmer until cheese is melted.

title: 181. BLACK BEAN SOUP
info:
BLACK BEAN SOUP

ingredients

1 lb. black beans
6 c. water
4 c. chicken stock
1/4 c. olive oil
1 large onion, chopped
1 1/2 tsp. cumin
1 1/2 tsp. oregano
2 tsp. salt
1 1/2 c. cooked rice
4 Tbsp. garlic, minced

preparation

Cook beans in water. Cover and simmer (add salt) until most of the water is soaked up. Add stock and continue to cook 1 to 1 1/2 hours more.

In separate skillet, brown in olive oil garlic, onions, cumin and oregano. Add to beans after they have finished cooking. Cook 10 to 15 minutes longer.

Take 2 cups bean mixture and puree. Add back to soup along with rice. Top with sour cream and chives when served.

title: 158. TACO SOUP
info:
TACO SOUP

ingredients

2 lb. ground beef
1 small onion
1 small bottle mild Ortega taco sauce
3 cans (14.5 oz.) Sweet Sue beef broth
salt to taste
1 tsp. chili powder
1/2 tsp. cumin
1 1/2 tsp. oregano
3 cans (16 oz.) Bush's mixed beans
1 (14.5 oz.) can Hunt's Choice diced tomatoes

preparation

Brown meat and drain. Put all ingredients in a large pot. Cook on low, covered, for 1 1/2 hours. Serve with Mexican finely shredded cheese and Santitos tortillas chips.

title: 71. PUMPKIN VEGETABLE SOUP
info:
PUMPKIN VEGETABLE SOUP

ingredients

1 large onion, chopped
2 Tbsp. butter
3 c. chicken or beef broth
1/2 bag frozen mixed vegetables
1 large potato
1 stalk celery, sliced
1 (16 oz.) can garbanzos or white kidney beans
1 (16 oz.) can pumpkin puree
1/2 tsp. salt
1/4 tsp. ground nutmeg
1/8 tsp. white pepper
1/2 pt. heavy or whipping cream

preparation

In a Dutch oven, sauté onion 5 minutes in hot butter. Add broth and heat to boiling; add vegetables, potato, celery and beans. Then cover and cook until potatoes are tender. Add pumpkin and seasoning; over high heat, heat to boiling. Cover and reduce to low; cook 5 minutes. Stir in cream and heat through. Serve in hollowed out pumpkin. Can add small amount of raw pumpkin, put in with vegetables, if desired. Makes 8 servings.

title: 33. BLACK BEAN SOUP
info:
BLACK BEAN SOUP

ingredients

1 1/2 c. black beans
1 1/2 qt. water or vegetable stock
2 Tbsp. oil
1 onion
2 stalks celery
1 potato
1 carrot
1 tsp. oregano
1/4 tsp. savory
2 tsp. sea salt
1/8 tsp. cayenne pepper
1 bay leaf
juice of 1 lemon

preparation

Wash the beans and put into a saucepan along with stock and 1 tablespoon oil. Cover, boil and simmer for 2 1/2 hours. Chop onion and sauté in remaining oil until soft. Chop celery and leaves. Grate potato and carrot. Add these to onion and cook over medium heat for several minutes. Add veggies to beans in the last hour they are cooking. Add oregano, savory, salt, pepper and bay leaf. Simmer until done. Add lemon juice. Delicious served over cooked brown rice. Yields 8 to 10 servings.

title: 250. MINESTRONE SOUP
info:
MINESTRONE SOUP

ingredients

6 c. water
2 large cans whole tomatoes
1/2 c. celery
2 c. carrots
4 medium potatoes, cubed
1 large onion, chopped
2 tsp. salt
1 tsp. sugar
1 tsp. black pepper
1 lb. ground beef
1 lb. ground pork
2 eggs
1/2 c. bread crumbs
2 tsp. salt
dash of pepper
2 cans cut green beans, strained
1 can whole kernel corn, strained

preparation

Put first 9 ingredients in large pot and put on stove to simmer. While pot is simmering, prepare the following: Mix together ground beef and pork, eggs, bread crumbs, salt and pepper. Roll into small 1-inch meatballs; add to boiling pot on stove. Simmer 30 minutes, then add green beans and corn. Simmer another 10 minutes.
