title: 212. TUNA NOODLE SOUP
info:
TUNA NOODLE SOUP

ingredients

3 cans Campbell's Mushroom Soup
1 large bag egg noodles
3 cans of tuna (in water)
1 c milk
1 tbsp butter or margarine

preparation

Boil bag of egg noodles. Drain. Mix milk, butter, soup and tuna in a pan. Heat on medium heat for 3 minutes or until it is at a slight boil, mixing as it heats. Add mixture to noodles. Serve hot.

You can also add peas and serve on toast.

title: 208. ITALIAN MEATBALL SOUP
info:
ITALIAN MEATBALL SOUP

ingredients

1 -14 1/2 oz. can diced tomatoes, with onion and garlic
1 -14 oz. can beef broth
1 1/2 c. water
1/2 tsp. dried Italian seasoning, crushed
1/2 of a 16 oz. package of frozen Italian style meatballs
1 c. frozen mixed vegetables
1/2 cup uncooked pasta, small sized
1 Tbsp. finely shredded or grated parmesan cheese

preparation

In large saucepan, combine undrained tomatoes, beef broth, water, and Italian seasoning and bring to boiling. Stir in meatballs, frozen vegetables, and pasta. Return to boiling, reduce heat. Simmer covered for about 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Ladle soup into serving bowls and top with parmesan cheese. Makes 4 servings.

title: 264. CHUCK WAGON CHILI SOUP
info:
CHUCK WAGON CHILI SOUP

ingredients

12 oz. ground beef (chuck)
1 1/2 c. chopped onions
2 Tbsp. minced garlic
3 Tbsp. chili powder
2 tsp. ground cumin
1 small butternut squash, peeled, seeded and cut in 3/4-inch chunks (approximately 4 c.)
4 c. beef broth (from cubes)
1 (28 oz.) crushed tomatoes
1 (16 oz.) barbecue baked beans
1 (15.5 oz.) red kidney beans, rinsed
1 (15.5 oz.) pinto beans, rinsed

preparation

Sauté beef in a 5-quart pot over medium heat 4 minutes or until brown. Discard fat. Sauté onions and garlic in pot 4 minutes or until soft. Stir in chili powder and cumin, then squash, broth and 1 extra cup water. Cover and gently boil 15 minutes until squash is almost tender. Add tomatoes and beans; bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer 15 minutes to develop flavors. Serve with shredded Cheddar cheese and sliced scallions.

title: 69. CREAM OF ONION SOUP
info:
CREAM OF ONION SOUP

ingredients

6 medium onions, sliced
1/4 lb. butter
1/2 c. flour
1 to 1 1/2 tsp. salt
1/4 tsp. pepper
8 c. chicken stock or 8 c. water
1 2/3 c. cream
French bread
Swiss cheese, sliced

preparation

Sauté onions in butter until tender. Blend in flour, salt and pepper. Cook over low heat for 10 minutes. Gradually stir in chicken base or water. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Stir in cream just before serving. Put in ovenproof bowls. Add 1 slice toasted French bread. Top with Swiss cheese. Bake until cheese is melted.

title: 112. TAMALE LENTIL SOUP
info:
TAMALE LENTIL SOUP

ingredients

1/2 c. dry lentils
3 1/2 c. water
1 c. frozen whole kernel corn
1 c. frozen cut green beans
1 c. sliced zucchini or yellow summer squash
1 c. sliced celery
1 c. sliced carrot
1 (8 oz.) can stewed tomatoes
1/2 c. chopped onion
1 (7 3/4 oz.) can semi-condensed tomato soup
1/2 c. chopped green pepper
1 clove garlic, minced
3/4 tsp. chili powder
1/4 tsp. ground cumin
1/8 tsp. pepper
Tamale Topper
1/2 c. shredded Cheddar cheese (2 oz.)

preparation

In a Dutch oven, combine uncooked lentils and 1 1/2 cups water. Bring to boiling; reduce the heat. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes, then drain. Stir in remaining water, corn, beans, zucchini, celery, carrot, tomatoes, tomato soup, onion, green pepper, garlic, chili powder, cumin and pepper. Return to boiling, then reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 20 minutes or until vegetables are almost tender.

Tamale Topper: In a saucepan, place 3/4 cup cornmeal. Gradually stir in 1 1/4 cups skim milk. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat, then stir in a beaten egg. Drop Tamale Topper in six mounds onto the hot stew. Cover and simmer about 20 minutes or until topper is done. Sprinkle with cheese. Makes 6 servings with 6 grams fat per serving.

title: 256. BAKED POTATO SOUP
info:
BAKED POTATO SOUP

ingredients

6 large potatoes
1/2 stick butter
1/2 c. flour
7 c. milk
1 c. sour cream
salt and pepper
1 bunch green onions, chopped
1/2 lb. fried bacon, crumbled
1 1/2 c. grated Cheddar cheese

preparation

Bake potatoes until done. Let cool. Peel and dice potatoes. In large pot, melt butter on medium heat. Add flour and stir until well blended. Increase heat to medium, slowly adding milk until mixture is almost to a boil. Add potatoes, onions and bacon. Stir in cheese and sour cream. Salt and pepper to taste. Heat until cheese is melted and serve.

title: 46. ALMOND CREAM SOUP
info:
ALMOND CREAM SOUP

ingredients

3 Tbsp. butter
1/2 c. finely diced onion
1 c. finely diced celery
4 Tbsp. flour
2 tsp. salt
1/8 tsp. pepper
1/2 tsp. condiment sauce
4 c. milk
2 chicken bouillon cubes
1/2 c. blanched chopped almonds
slivered, toasted almonds (for garnish)

preparation

Melt butter; add onion and celery and cook over low heat until tender. Add flour, seasonings and condiment sauce; blend. Stir in milk and cook over low heat until smooth and thickened. Add bouillon cubes and stir to dissolve. Stir in blanched almonds. Turn into hot soup bowls and sprinkle with almonds. Serves 6.

title: 81. CAJUN SHRIMP SOUP
info:
CAJUN SHRIMP SOUP

ingredients

1/2 c. chopped green pepper
1/4 c. sliced green onion
1 clove garlic, minced
1 Tbsp. butter or margarine
3 c. vegetable juice cocktail
8 oz. bottle clam juice
1/2 c. water
1/2 tsp. salt
1/4 tsp. thyme, crushed
1/4 tsp. basil, crushed
1/8 to 1/4 tsp. red pepper flakes, crushed
1 bay leaf
1/2 c. uncooked long grain rice
12 oz. frozen cooked shrimp
hot pepper sauce, if desired

preparation

In a large saucepan, sauté green pepper, onion and garlic in margarine until tender. Stir in vegetable juice, clam juice, water, salt, thyme, basil, pepper flakes and bay leaf. Bring to boil. Reduce heat; add rice. Cover. Simmer 15 to 20 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in shrimp; simmer uncovered 3 to 5 minutes or until shrimp heat. Remove bay leaf. Add hot pepper sauce to individual servings as desired. Yields 4 servings.

title: 28. GUACAMOLE SOUP
info:
GUACAMOLE SOUP

ingredients

2 medium avocados
1 1/2 c. water
1 c. milk
2 Tbsp. lemon juice
2 tsp. seasoned salt
dash of red pepper sauce
1 medium tomato, chopped
lemon (for garnish)

preparation

Cut avocados lengthwise into quarters. Remove pits and peel. Mix avocados, water and milk in blender until smooth. Thoroughly stir in lemon juice, seasoned salt and red pepper sauce. Fold tomato into soup. Chill. If desired, garnish each serving with lemon slice. Yields eight 1/2-cup servings.

title: 60. CHUNKY POTATO SOUP
info:
CHUNKY POTATO SOUP

ingredients

2 Tbsp. butter
1 1/2 c. chopped onion
1 bay leaf
1/2 tsp. dried thyme
4 c. cubed potatoes
2 cans chicken broth
1/8 tsp. pepper
1 c. milk
1/2 tsp. salt
sliced green onions (optional)

preparation

In large saucepan, melt butter; add onions, bay leaf and thyme. Cook until onions are translucent. Add potatoes, broth and pepper. Boil until potatoes are tender. Remove bay leaf. With slotted spoon, remove about 2 cups of the potatoes and onions to a bowl. Puree remaining soup in a blender and return to saucepan. Stir in milk and the reserved potatoes and onions. Season with salt and heat just to boiling. Garnish with green onions, if desired.

title: 135. BEER-CHEESE SOUP
info:
BEER-CHEESE SOUP

ingredients

3/4 c. butter (1/2 c. okay)
1/2 c. finely diced celery
1/2 c. flour
1/2 c. finely diced carrots
1/2 c. finely diced onion
2 1/2 pt. chicken stock
1/2 tsp. dry mustard
8 oz. Cheddar cheese
2 Tbsp. Parmesan cheese
11 oz. bottle flat beer
salt and pepper to taste

preparation

Sauté vegetables until cooked, but not brown. Blend in flour, dry mustard and chicken stock; cook for 5 minutes. Blend in Parmesan cheese, Cheddar cheese and beer. Simmer 20 minutes. Season and serve with French bread and tossed salad. Serves 4 to 6.

title: 39. EGGPLANT PARMESAN SOUP
info:
EGGPLANT PARMESAN SOUP

ingredients

1 Tbsp. olive oil
1/2 stick margarine or butter
1 medium onion, chopped coarsely
1 tsp. minced garlic
2 medium-size eggplants, firm
2 (28 oz.) cans crushed tomatoes (with added puree)
1 tsp. basil
1 tsp. oregano
1 1/4 c. Parmesan cheese, grated

preparation

Sauté in soup pot in olive oil and margarine or butter the onion and garlic. Skin and cube eggplants; add to onion and garlic; sauté for 3 minutes, stirring often. Then just cover mixture with water; let cook until eggplants are tender. Add crushed tomatoes, basil and oregano; puree entire mixture in blender. Return everything to soup pot; add Parmesan cheese. Adjust consistency of soup with added water, if needed. It should be neither thin nor thick; cook over low heat for 1 hour, covered. Garnish with additional Parmesan cheese and parsley at table.

Note: Best if made 8 hours in advance.

title: 59. CHILLED AVOCADO AND CUCUMBER SOUP
info:
CHILLED AVOCADO AND CUCUMBER SOUP

ingredients

2 large ripe avocados
2 large cucumbers
2 c. chicken broth
juice of 2 limes
1/4 c. diced green chilies
1 c. (1/2 pt.) heavy cream
salt to taste
chopped chives (optional)

preparation

Peel and seed avocados and cucumbers. Blend avocados with 1 cup of broth until smooth in food processor or blender. Stir in lime juice. Set aside. Blend cucumbers, remaining 1 cup of broth and chilies until smooth. Combine with avocado mixture. Stir in cream and salt to taste. Serve very cold. Garnish with chives, if desired. Serves 4.

title: 146. CHICKEN TACO SOUP
info:
CHICKEN TACO SOUP

ingredients

1 lb. chicken breast, boned and skinned
2 Tbsp. olive oil
1 pkg. taco seasoning
1 onion, finely chopped
1 clove garlic, minced
1 (15 oz.) can stewed tomatoes
1 (4 oz.) can green chilies, chopped
1 1/2 c. broth
1 (8 oz.) can black beans, rinsed
1 (15 oz.) can pinto beans
broken corn chips
grated Cheddar cheese

preparation

Boil chicken until done. After it cools, shred with fork. In large saucepan, combine olive oil, taco seasoning, onion, garlic and chicken. Cook until onions are clear. Combine all ingredients and cook until thoroughly heated. Serve in individual bowls with corn chips and top with shredded cheese.

title: 238. SPICY BLACK-EYED PEA SOUP
info:
SPICY BLACK-EYED PEA SOUP

ingredients

5 slices bacon
1 c. onion, chopped
2 Tbsp. jalapeno, finely chopped
2 c. chopped canned tomatoes
1 clove garlic, minced
3 c. hot water
3 beef bouillon cubes
4 (15.8 oz.) cans black-eyed peas
1 c. grated Cheddar or Swiss cheese

preparation

Cut bacon into small pieces; sauté until brown. Drain. Pour out grease in pan. Add onion, bacon, jalapeno, garlic and tomato to pan. Sauté. Dissolve bouillon in hot water. Drain peas; add to bouillon, then add to onion and bacon mixture. Simmer together. Serve hot with cheese sprinkled on each serving.

title: 257. CREAM OF ANYTHING SOUP
info:
CREAM OF ANYTHING SOUP

ingredients

4 Tbsp. butter
1 lb. any vegetable, trimmed, washed and chopped
6 scallions, sliced
3 c. chicken broth
1/2 c. white wine
2 Tbsp. chopped parsley
1 Tbsp. lemon juice
1 tsp. tarragon
4 tsp. sugar
1 c. heavy cream

preparation

In large pot, melt butter. Add vegetables and scallions and cook, stirring often, until vegetables are soft but not browned (about 20 minutes). Add chicken stock, wine, parsley, lemon juice, tarragon and sugar. Simmer, covered, about 30 minutes until vegetables are very soft. Puree soup in blender or food processor and transfer to large bowl. Add heavy cream and stir thoroughly. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Makes about 6 servings.

title: 268. VEGETABLE BARLEY SOUP
info:
VEGETABLE BARLEY SOUP

ingredients

any cut beef or bone
2 beef bouillon cubes
1 large can V-8 juice
1 can chopped tomatoes
chopped cabbage
chopped onions and celery
assorted vegetables (prefer fresh)
barley

preparation

Cover beef with water in large pot and cook about 20 minutes after water starts to boil. Skim top. Remove beef, cut into pieces and put back in stock. Add V-8 juice, tomatoes and all other veggies. Cook about 1 hour or until veggies are soft. Add barley to pot of soup and cook according to package or cook barley in separate pot.

title: 40. TOMATO CARROT SOUP
info:
TOMATO CARROT SOUP

ingredients

2 Tbsp. unsalted butter
1 yellow onion, peeled and chopped
1/2 lb. carrots, peeled and chopped
1 tsp. curry powder
7 large ripe plum tomatoes
3 1/2 c. chicken broth
6 Tbsp. slivered basil leaves
salt and pepper to taste
sour cream

preparation

Melt butter in pot and add onion. Sauté for five minutes. Add carrots and curry powder. Cover and cook 20 minutes more. Remove skin on tomatoes by dipping in boiling water for 30 seconds, then chop coarsely; add tomatoes and chicken broth to saucepan with vegetables. Bring to boil, lower heat and simmer for 20 minutes. Add 2 tablespoons basil, salt and pepper; simmer 1 minute. Transfer soup to blender or food processor and puree until smooth. Stir in remaining basil. Serve cold or hot topped with a dollop of sour cream. Makes 2 to 4 servings.

title: 93. TURKEY VEGETABLE SOUP
info:
TURKEY VEGETABLE SOUP

ingredients

1/2 stick margarine
2 medium onions, diced
2 Tbsp. flour
3 c. chicken broth
1 c. potatoes, diced
1/2 c. carrots, sliced
1/2 c. celery, diced
1/2 tsp. poultry seasoning
2 c. cooked turkey, cubed
1 1/2 c. half and half
1 tsp. salt
1/2 tsp. ground pepper

preparation

Melt margarine in large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add onions; sauté until translucent. Stir in flour. Add broth, potatoes, carrots, celery and poultry seasoning. Simmer until vegetables are tender. Add turkey and half and half. Add seasonings. Cover and continue simmering until heated through. Serve hot.

title: 207. COLD AVOCADO SOUP
info:
COLD AVOCADO SOUP

ingredients

3 ripe avocadoes
1 c. low fat sour cream
1 can low sodium chicken broth, chilled
juice from 2 limes
salt and pepper to taste
1/2 tsp. chili powder, optional
dash of tabasco, optional
diced avocado and/or tomato for garnish

preparation

Put all ingredients except garnish in a blender or food processor and blend until smooth. Refrigerate until chilled. Pour the soup into serving bowls and top with garnish.

title: 260. GRAMA JULIA'S BEEF SOUP
info:
GRAMA JULIA'S BEEF SOUP
(Hungarian Style)

ingredients

1 lb. beef chuck
2 knuckle bones, cracked
2 qt. cold water
2 Tbsp. salt
1/2 tsp. paprika
2 large carrots
2 parsley roots and greens
2 stalks celery
1 fresh tomato
1 medium onion
2 cabbage leaves
2 medium potatoes
8 whole black peppercorns

preparation

Wash meat and bones. Place in large pot. Add water. Let it come to a boil; skim off fat. Prepare vegetables by washing and paring as necessary. Add seasoning and vegetables except potatoes. Simmer for 2 1/2 hours. Add whole potatoes; simmer for another 1/2 hour. When done, strain soup. Serve as consomme or with Crum Noodles.

Crum Noodles:

ingredients

1 egg
1/4 tsp. salt
1 c. flour
1/2 eggshell of water

preparation

Sift flour and salt into bowl. Add egg and 1/2 eggshell of water. Mix thoroughly by hand to form a ball (hard). Grate on potato grater. Dry on pastry board.

title: 235. CHICKEN-RICE-VEGETABLE SOUP-STEW
info:
CHICKEN-RICE-VEGETABLE SOUP-STEW

ingredients

2 1/2 to 3 lb. fryer, cut up and remove excess fat
2 1/2 qt. water
1 1/2 tsp. salt
3 or 4 peppercorns
2 bouillon cubes
2 to 3 ribs celery
1 medium onion
2 to 3 medium carrots, cut up
1 sprig parsley or dried flakes
1 strip bell pepper (if desired)
3/4 c. rice (regular)
1/4 c. frozen green beans, baby limas or both
1/4 c. frozen green peas
2 c. to 1 qt. milk

preparation

Cook first 4 ingredients together; simmer until tender, about 30 minutes. Remove chicken from broth. Strain broth and return to clean kettle. Add to boiling broth the next 8 ingredients. Cook 20 minutes or so. Add chopped chicken. Add frozen green peas. Cook until done, at least 10 more minutes. Add milk; add thickening, if desired, and adjust seasoning. If canned vegetables are used, add with chopped chicken. Serves 10.

title: 78. CATTLEMAN'S STEAK SOUP
info:
CATTLEMAN'S STEAK SOUP

ingredients

1 1/2 lb. ground round steak
2 Tbsp. vegetable oil
8 Tbsp. butter
1 c. flour
8 c. water
2 c. sliced carrots
1 1/2 c. sliced celery
1 large onion, chopped
1 (16 oz.) pkg. mixed frozen vegetables
1 (16 oz.) can tomatoes, chopped
1 tsp. Accent
4 Tbsp. Kitchen Bouquet
3 tsp. beef stock base
salt and pepper to taste

preparation

In large skillet, brown steak well in oil, drain and set aside. In a soup pot, melt butter and add flour, stirring constantly. Very slowly add water, one cup at a time, to prevent mixture from becoming lumpy. Add carrots, celery and onion. Add mixed frozen vegetables and tomatoes. Add Accent, Kitchen Bouquet, beef stock base, salt and pepper to taste. Add browned meat, cover and simmer on low for 3 to 4 hours, stirring occasionally. Uncover after 2 hours of cooking to thicken. Serve hot with corn bread and green salad. A thick hearty soup for Texas men's appetites, served on a cold winter day!

title: 218. GREAT VEGETABLE SOUP
info:
GREAT VEGETABLE SOUP

ingredients

3 Tbsp Butter
1 quart Chicken Broth
1/4 head Broccoli (florets)
1/4 head Cauliflower
1/2 bunch scallions (sliced)
4 carrots (sliced)
3 to 4 turnips (chopped)
1/2 cup Savoy Cabbage (sliced)
1/2 cup Fresh Parsley (chopped)

preparation

Sauté vegetables in skillet in 3 tbsp of butter until crisp tender. When almost done, bring broth to a boil. Add softened vegetables to boiling broth. Simmer 15 minutes until tender.

title: 159. TOMATO CELERY SOUP
info:
TOMATO CELERY SOUP

ingredients

1 small onion, chopped
1/2 c. finely chopped celery
2 Tbsp. butter
1 (10 1/2 oz.) can tomato soup
1 can soup
1 tsp. minced parsley
1 Tbsp. lemon juice
1 tsp. sugar
1/4 tsp. salt
1/8 tsp. pepper

preparation

Sauté onion and celery in butter. Do not brown. Add remaining ingredients. Simmer for 5 minutes. Celery will remain crisp. Serve topped with unsweetened whipping cream and chopped parsley. Serves 3 to 4.

title: 168. FRIENDSHIP SOUP MIX IN A JAR
info:
FRIENDSHIP SOUP MIX IN A JAR

ingredients

1/2 c. dry split peas
1/3 c. beef bouillon granules
1/4 c. pearl barley
1/2 c. dry lentils
1/4 c. dried minced onion
2 tsp. Italian seasoning
1/2 c. uncooked long grain rice
1/2 c. alphabet macaroni*

preparation

*Or other small pasta (can be put in a plastic sandwich bag to make it easier for the recipient to get out of jar).

In a 1 1/2-pint jar, layer the first 8 ingredients in the order listed. Seal tightly. Yield: 1 package.

To give as a gift, include the following instructions on your gift tag.

Friendship Soup Mix In A Jar:

ingredients

1 pkg. layered Friendship Soup Mix
1 lb. ground beef
3 qt. water
1 (28 oz.) can diced tomatoes (undrained)

preparation

Carefully remove macaroni from top of jar and set aside. In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, brown beef; drain. Add the water, tomatoes and soup mix; bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 45 minutes. Add reserved macaroni; cover and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes or until macaroni, peas, lentils and barley are tender. Yield: 16 servings (4 quarts).

title: 267. FRENCH TOMATO SOUP
info:
FRENCH TOMATO SOUP
(Soup A la Tomate)

ingredients

1 Tbsp. butter
1 small onion
1 lb. fresh tomatoes
2 Tbsp. flour
1 qt. water
salt and pepper
basil leaves
thyme
1 Tbsp. brown sugar

preparation

You will need a blender or electric mixer.

In a large pan, melt the butter and add the onions, diced. Wash the tomatoes and cut them into small pieces. Add the tomatoes into the pan and stir for 30 seconds. Add the flour and stir for another 30 seconds. Add the water slowly while continuing to stir. Add the salt, pepper, basil leaves, thyme and brown sugar. Let it cook slowly over low heat for about 50 minutes while stirring every few minutes. Then pour into the blender and liquify the soup for just a few seconds. Now it is ready to serve.

title: 111. CHICKEN AND ESCAROLE SOUP
info:
CHICKEN AND ESCAROLE SOUP

ingredients

1 lb. hamburger
2 slices bread (wet), broken up
2 eggs
1 1/2 c. grated Cheddar cheese
1/2 c. Parmesan cheese
salt to taste
oregano to taste

preparation

Boil 1 chicken or stewing hen. Squeeze 1/2 lemon into stock. Use 2 or 3 cubes chicken bouillon or 2 tablespoons chicken soup base. Boil with celery, onion and garlic. Remove chicken and pick meat off bones. Return meat to stock. The fat needs to be skimmed off. (It's easier to refrigerate and then skim off and re-cook the next day.) Heat stock. Add meatballs and cook about 2 hours. Just before serving, add one bunch escarole (spinach), chopped up. Heat and serve.

title: 34. FRESH PEA SOUP
info:
FRESH PEA SOUP

ingredients

1 1/2 lb. fresh green peas
1 Tbsp. butter
1 large onion, minced
1 3/4 c. chicken stock, divided
1 c. lite cream
salt to taste
ground black pepper to taste
fresh herbs (optional)

preparation

Shell peas and measure about 2 cups; set aside. In a large saucepan, melt the butter. Add the onion and sauté until tender. In a separate saucepan add 1/2 cup chicken stock to the fresh peas. Cover and steam about 5 to 7 minutes. Do not drain. Add the peas and remaining chicken stock to the sautéed onions; cover and simmer about 10 minutes. Puree about 1/3 of the mixture at a time in a blender or food processor. Return puree to the saucepan and stir in the cream. Season with salt and pepper. You may also add snipped fresh herbs such as dill, parsley, chives or basil. Serves 4.

title: 89. HOMEMADE CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP
info:
HOMEMADE CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP

ingredients

1 whole chicken (about 4 lb.)
5 large potatoes, cut up
1 large onion, chopped
1/2 c. celery, chopped
1/2 c. carrots, chopped
salt to taste
pepper to taste
1/2 bag egg noodles

preparation

Boil chicken for an hour. Drain water, but save. Let chicken cool. Add all other ingredients except noodles to chicken broth and boil again. Remove chicken from bones and add meat to soup. Boil at least 1 hour; add noodles and serve.

title: 22. TURKEY NOODLE SOUP
info:
TURKEY NOODLE SOUP

ingredients

1 turkey carcass, cut in pieces
water
1 c. sliced celery
1 onion, sliced
1 c. sliced carrots
salt to taste
8 oz. medium noodles

preparation

Put turkey carcass pieces in large kettle and cover with water. Cover kettle and simmer 1 1/2 hours. Skim surface to remove excess fat. Add vegetables and salt and simmer 15 minutes. Add noodles and simmer about 15 minutes. Serve hot.

title: 43. COLD MELON SOUP
info:
COLD MELON SOUP

ingredients

3 c. coarsely chopped honeydew and cantaloupe melons
2 c. fresh orange juice
1/3 c. fresh lime juice
3 Tbsp. honey
2 c. dry champagne
1 c. whipping cream, whipped
fresh mint leaves

preparation

Finely chop 1 1/2 cups of honeydew and cantaloupe and set aside. Place remaining melon, orange juice, lime juice and honey in blender and puree for a few seconds. Pour into a large bowl; stir in champagne and reserved melon. Cover and refrigerate. Garnish when serving with whipped cream (a dollop per bowl) and mint leaves. Good soup for company. Very refreshing on a hot day. Serves 6 to 8.

title: 286. CHILE POBLANO CREAM SOUP
info:
CHILE POBLANO CREAM SOUP

ingredients

1/4 c. butter
1 onion, diced
1 can Poblano peppers
2 c. chicken stock
1 Tbsp. cilantro
garlic salt to taste
1 c. heavy cream
8 oz. Monterey Jack cheese, cubed
3 corn tortillas, cut in squares and fried

preparation

Melt the butter and sauté the onion until translucent and tender. Add the poblano chilies and continue to sauté a little longer, breaking up chilies into little pieces. Blend in chicken stock, cilantro and garlic salt. Add the cream and heat until very hot but not boiling. Serve immediately with the cheese and tortillas. Serves 4.

title: 151. GRANDMA'S SOUP
info:
GRANDMA'S SOUP

ingredients

1 qt. water
2 beef shanks (with bone in it)
1 (32 oz.) can tomato juice
4 bay leaves
6 allspice
6 cloves
1/2 lb. elbow macaroni
1 pt. sour cream

preparation

Boil the shanks in water with spices until meat is cooked (about 1 1/2 hours). Pour in equal amounts of tomato juice (1/2 can) and water (1/2 qt.). Cook mixture down until it is reduced by half. Add cooked elbow macaroni, and the left over water (1/2 qt.) and mix well. Add 1 pint sour cream that is mixed with left over tomato juice. Ready to serve, Yum! Yum!

title: 196. CHICKEN AND WILD RICE SOUP
info:
CHICKEN AND WILD RICE SOUP

ingredients

1 whole fryer (or 4 boneless chicken breasts)
chicken broth
1 1/2 c. wild rice (use broken, not long grain)
chicken bouillon cubes (to taste)
salt and pepper to taste
1 Tbsp. onion and garlic powder
1 Tbsp. poultry seasoning (to taste)
1/2 onion, chopped fine
2 or 3 carrots, chopped fine
2 or 3 celery ribs, chopped fine
1 to 2 c. Half and Half
corn starch or flour

preparation

Cook chicken and cut up. In remaining broth, boil wild rice until it starts to pop (about 45 minutes to an hour). Add as many bouillon cubes as desired; add salt and pepper. Add onion and garlic powder, poultry seasoning, onion, carrots, and celery. Cook until vegetables are tender. Add chicken to soup; add 1 to 2 c. Half and Half for color; thicken with corn starch or flour. Adjust seasoning to your taste.

title: 88. PENNSYLVANIA DUTCH STYLE CHICKEN AND CORN SOUP
info:
PENNSYLVANIA DUTCH STYLE CHICKEN AND CORN SOUP

ingredients

1 chicken (preferably 4 lb. hen)
4 qt. water
2 1/2 c. fresh or frozen corn
1 onion, chopped
1/2 c. chopped celery and leaves
salt and pepper to taste
2 cooked eggs (optional)

preparation

Cook chicken in water slowly until it is tender, adding salt 30 minutes before it is done. Remove chicken and strain broth through a fine sieve. Take meat from bones and cut in bite size pieces. Set aside. Add corn to broth. Add onion, chopped celery and seasoning; cook 5 minutes. Five minutes before serving, add chicken, diced eggs and rivels.

Rivels:

ingredients

1 c. flour
1 egg
1/4 c. milk

preparation

Rub rivel mixture together with 2 forks until the size of peas and drop into boiling soup. Cover and cook gently for 5 minutes. Delicious!!

title: 294. GREEN BEAN SOUP
info:
GREEN BEAN SOUP
(German)

ingredients

3-4 cans green beans (do not drain)
6 slices bacon
2 Tbsp. flour
1 medium onion
6 medium potatoes
3-4 tsp. chicken paste or bouillon cubes to taste
Maggi liquid seasoning (if available)
Salt and pepper to taste

preparation

In a stockpot peel potatoes, and cut into bite size pieces. Bring potatoes to a boil. Cut bacon and onion into tiny pieces. Add to separate skillet, simmer until bacon is pretty done and onions are clear. Remove bacon and onions, leaving liquid. Add flour (more or less depending on how thick you want soup to be), making a roux. When potatoes are done, add roux and chicken paste or bouillon cubes, and green beans to stockpot of boiling potatoes. Season with small amount of Maggi and/or salt and pepper.

title: 219. ONION SOUP
info:
ONION SOUP

ingredients

1 very large onion
3 tbsp butter
6 beef bouillon cubes dissolved in 6 cups of hot water
fresh ground pepper
dash of sherry (optional)
French or Italian Bread
Melting Cheese of your choice

preparation

Brown sliced onion in the butter until dark brown (caramel colored). Add fresh pepper to taste. Add beef bouillon. Simmer 1/2 hour, add dash of sherry if you would like. Toast bread slices dark - put one on each serving, add cheese and broil until cheese browns.

title: 241. POTATO SOUP
info:
POTATO SOUP

ingredients

1 Tbsp. unsalted butter
1 medium onion (about 6 oz.), peeled and finely chopped
3 baking potatoes (about 10 oz. each), peeled and cut into 1/4-inch slices
6 c. chicken broth
1/4 tsp. celery seed
kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
buttermilk or extra chicken broth (if desired)

preparation

Melt butter in large saucepan over moderate heat. Stir in onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until onion is translucent (about 5 minutes). Add potato slices and broth; bring to boil over high heat. Reduce heat to moderate and simmer, stirring occasionally, until potatoes are almost cooked through (about 15 minutes). Add celery seed and cook 5 minutes longer, stirring frequently to break up potato slices. Gently whisk with balloon whisk until soup becomes a little smoother, but small pieces of potato should remain. Season with salt and pepper. If not serving immediately, you may want to add a little buttermilk or extra chicken broth because soup will get thicker as it stands. Makes 6 (1-cup) servings.

title: 74. ZUCCHINI WITH CHICKEN SOUP
info:
ZUCCHINI WITH CHICKEN SOUP

ingredients

4 medium zucchini, sliced 1/2 inch thick
1/3 c. onion, chopped
6 Tbsp. margarine, melted
1 c. sour cream
1 can condensed cream of chicken soup
1 c. shredded carrots
2 c. seasoned bread crumbs

preparation

Sauté zucchini and onion in 4 tablespoons margarine until tender. Combine zucchini and onion with sour cream, cream of chicken soup, shredded carrots and 1 1/2 cups bread crumbs in 1 1/2-quart greased casserole. Sprinkle with remaining crumbs tossed with 2 tablespoons margarine. Bake for 30 minutes at 350°.

Note: May substitute cream of shrimp or mushroom soup with chopped green peppers.

title: 192. ENCHILADA SOUP
info:
ENCHILADA SOUP

ingredients

1 small onion, chopped
1 Tbsp. steak sauce
1 garlic clove, crushed
1 tsp. ground cumin
2 Tbsp. vegetable oil
1 tsp. chili powder
1 can cream of chicken soup
2 tsp. Worcestershire
1 can chicken broth
2 Tbsp. enchilada seasoning
1 can beef broth
paprika
1 can (4 oz.) chopped green chilies undrained
1 bag Tostitos chips
1 jar (15 oz.) of queso cheese dip
1 1/2 c. water
1 to 2 lb. ground meat
1/8 tsp. black pepper

preparation

Sauté onion and garlic in oil over medium high heat. Add ground meat to onions and garlic; brown. Add undiluted soups, chilies, water, steak sauce, Worcestershire sauce, cumin, chili powder, pepper, and enchilada seasoning; bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat; simmer 1 hour. Add chips and queso cheese dip. Simmer uncovered 10 minutes. Sprinkle with paprika and serve.

Note: The more chips added, the thicker the soup will be. Also, you can substitute 3 boneless chicken breasts for the ground meat, using chicken broth instead of plain water.

title: 246. TOMATO SOUP SALAD
info:
TOMATO SOUP SALAD

ingredients

1 c. tomato soup (undiluted)
1 c. mayonnaise
1 c. celery, diced
1/4 to 1/2 c. onion, chopped
1 (3 oz.) pkg. lemon jello
1 c. cottage cheese
1 c. bell pepper, chopped

preparation

Heat undiluted soup until hot, but not boiling. Stir in lemon jello until dissolved. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Pour into mold and refrigerate.

title: 27. ASPARAGUS SOUP
info:
ASPARAGUS SOUP

ingredients

1 can (approximately 1 lb.) asparagus
bouillon cubes or powder to make 4 c.
1 qt. boiling water
dash of onion powder
pinch of powdered mace

preparation

Put asparagus pieces and liquid in blender and blend smooth. In saucepan, combine bouillon and boiling water; add asparagus. Add seasonings. Bring to a boil. Serve hot with a dot of unsalted butter on each cup or soup plate.

title: 98. ASPARAGUS AND CHICKEN SOUP
info:
ASPARAGUS AND CHICKEN SOUP

ingredients

8 c. chicken stock
1 large chicken breast
1 bunch fresh asparagus
4 tsp. cornstarch
3 Tbsp. cold water
2 1/2 Tbsp. dry sherry
2 eggs, beaten

preparation

Heat stock. Cut chicken into small pieces. After asparagus is cooked, cut into small pieces. Save 1 cup of water to add to chicken stock. Add chicken and boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Mix cornstarch with cold water and add to soup, stirring constantly. Add sherry. Slowly add beaten eggs and asparagus. Heat through.

title: 277. MUSHROOM SOUP
info:
MUSHROOM SOUP

ingredients

6 cups homemade chicken broth, or three cans (14 1/2-oz. each) prepared chicken broth
1/3 c. wild rice
2 c. half-and-half cream
4 Tbsp. flour
1/4 tsp. thyme
4 Tbsp. butter
1 c. sliced green onion
1 lb. fresh mushrooms, sliced

preparation

In a large saucepan combine chicken broth and wild rice. Bring to boil; reduce heat to low, cover and simmer until rice is cooked. Whisk flour and thyme into cream; add to broth and rice stirring constantly and heat until thickened. Meanwhile, melt butter in skillet and sauté mushrooms and onions for about 5 minutes; add to soup mixture. Cook a few minutes more until hot but not boiling. Serve immediately. Serves 8.

title: 206. CHEESE SOUP
info:
CHEESE SOUP

ingredients

4 chicken bouillon cubes
1 qt. water
1 c. diced celery
1 c. diced onion
2 1/2 c. potatoes, diced
1 c. diced carrots
2 cans cream of chicken soup
1 - 1 lb. velveeta cheese, cubed

preparation

Cook chicken bouillon, water, celery, and onion for 20 minutes in large pot with lid on. Add potatoes and carrots. Cook another 20 minutes or until tender. Add cream of chicken soup and cheese cubes. Heat through until the cheese melts, stirring often. If too thick, add a little more water. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Soup can be frozen.

title: 55. CREAM OF TOMATO SOUP
info:
CREAM OF TOMATO SOUP

ingredients

2 c. tomato juice
1/2 stick margarine
5 Tbsp. flour
1/2 tsp. salt
1/8 tsp. pepper
2 c. milk
1/8 tsp. baking soda

preparation

In small stew pan, place tomato juice and place on stove to warm. In larger pan, melt margarine; remove from heat. Mix in flour, salt and pepper; stir until smooth. Add milk and place on stove; bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Cook until thickened; remove from heat. Stir baking soda into warm tomato juice and then stir into gravy mixture. Serve with crackers or garlic toast.

title: 156. POTATO SOUP
info:
POTATO SOUP

ingredients

6 slices bacon, fried and drained
3 Tbsp. bacon grease
3/4 c. onion
3 c. potatoes, cut small
1 1/2 c. water
2 cans cream of mushroom soup
salt to taste
2 soup cans of milk

preparation

Pour off all but 3 tablespoons of bacon grease. Saut onions in grease and add potatoes, salt and water. Cook until potatoes are done. Add soup and milk. Serve with crumbled bacon on top. Makes 8 servings.

title: 160. TORTILLA SOUP
info:
TORTILLA SOUP

ingredients

4 chicken bouillon cubes
1 beef bouillon cube
5 c. boiling water
4 boneless chicken breasts, cut in 1/2-inch pieces
1 tsp. cumin
2 Tbsp. vegetable oil
1 green bell pepper, chopped
1 large onion, chopped
garlic salt or powder to taste
1 (10 oz.) can beef consomm
1 (10 oz.) can Ro-Tel tomatoes, drained and chopped
1 (16 oz.) can peeled tomatoes, drained and chopped
1 (15 oz.) can tomato sauce
1 can chopped green chilies, drained (optional)
2 Tbsp. cornstarch
salt and pepper to taste

preparation

Dissolve bouillon cubes in boiling water in large soup pot. Stir in chicken and cumin. Simmer over low heat 2 hours. Heat oil in saucepan. Add green pepper, onion and garlic. Sauté until tender. Stir into soup pot. Add consomm, tomatoes, tomato sauce and green chilies. Mix well. Blend cornstarch with 1 tablespoon soup liquid. Stir into soup. Simmer 1 to 2 hours or until heated through, stirring occasionally. Add salt and pepper. In individual serving bowl, top with tortilla chips, shredded Monterey Jack cheese, chopped onion or chopped avocado if you like.

title: 199. DELI'S TACO SOUP
info:
DELI'S TACO SOUP

ingredients

1 lb. ground chuck
1 onion, chopped
1/2 c. celery, chopped
1/2 c. bell pepper, chopped
1 can whole kernel corn
1 can pinto beans
1 can tomatoes, diced
1 can evaporated milk
1 small pkg. Velveeta
1 envelope taco seasoning
TexJoy steak seasoning, to taste

preparation

Brown meat with onion, celery, and bell pepper. Add taco seasoning when meat is done. Add cans of vegetables, milk and cheese and simmer until done. Add small amount of water if it is too thick.

title: 96. CABBAGE PATCH SOUP
info:
CABBAGE PATCH SOUP

ingredients

1 c. chopped onion
2 cloves garlic
1 c. chopped green pepper
1 tsp. oregano
1 1/2 to 2 Tbsp. chili powder
2 lb. lean ground beef
1 (6 oz.) can tomato paste
3 beef bouillon cubes
1 (15 oz.) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained
1 (16 oz.) can stewed tomatoes
1/2 head red cabbage, chopped
1/2 head white cabbage, chopped
Cheddar cheese (optional)

preparation

Sauté onion, garlic, green pepper, oregano, chili powder and beef together. Drain fat, if any. Then add 7 to 8 cups water, depending on desired thickness. Add remaining ingredients, except cheese. Bring mixture to a boil and simmer for 1 hour. Can top with Cheddar cheese, grated. Serve with cornbread.

title: 83. CHESAPEAKE BAY CRAB SOUP
info:
CHESAPEAKE BAY CRAB SOUP

ingredients

1/4 c. butter
1/2 c. chopped onion
1/2 c. chopped green bell pepper
4 c. fish stock or bottled clam juice
1/4 c. long-grain rice
1 lb. lump crabmeat, free of shell and cartilage
1 large tomato, peeled and diced
1 tsp. chili powder
1 tsp. paprika
1/2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1/2 tsp. sugar
salt and pepper to taste

preparation

Melt butter in a 2-quart pot and sauté onion and green pepper until onion is soft. Add fish stock and rice. Simmer, partially covered, 15 minutes. Add crabmeat, tomato, chili powder, paprika and Worcestershire and simmer 20 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in sugar, salt and pepper. Makes 4 servings.

title: 134. SPINACH SOUP
info:
SPINACH SOUP

ingredients

4 Tbsp. margarine
1 c. diced raw potatoes
1/2 c. sliced onions
1 c. sliced fresh mushrooms
1 lb. fresh spinach, chopped finely
4 c. chicken broth (College Inn)
salt and pepper to taste
1/4 tsp. ground cloves
1/2 c. oatmeal

preparation

In skillet, melt margarine on low heat and add potatoes, onions and mushrooms. Cover pan and cook 8 to 10 minutes, until soft and translucent. Wash spinach; pick off tough stems and chop finely. Pour stock into large pan and add potatoes, onions, mushrooms and spinach. Season with salt, pepper and cloves. Add oatmeal. Simmer 20 minutes.

title: 118. BAKED POTATO SOUP
info:
BAKED POTATO SOUP

ingredients

4 large baking potatoes
2/3 c. butter or margarine
2/3 c. all-purpose flour
6 c. milk
3/4 tsp. salt
1/2 tsp. pepper
4 green onions, chopped and divided
12 slices bacon, cooked, crumbled and divided
1 1/4 c. (5 oz.) shredded Cheddar cheese, divided
1 (8 oz.) carton sour cream

preparation

Wash potatoes and prick several times with a fork; bake at 400° for 1 hour or until done. Let cool. Cut potatoes in half lengthwise; then scoop out pulp and set aside. Discard skins. Melt butter in a heavy saucepan over low heat; add flour, stirring until smooth. Cook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Gradually add milk; cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is thickened and bubbly. Add potato pulp, salt, pepper, 2 tablespoons green onions, 1/2 cup bacon and 1 cup cheese. Cook until thoroughly heated; stir in sour cream. Add extra milk, if necessary, for desired thickness. Serve with remaining onion, bacon and cheese.

title: 213. WEDDING SOUP
info:
WEDDING SOUP

ingredients

meatballs, dime sized
1 egg
1 small onion, diced
1/2-1 c Italian bread crumbs
1/4 c parmesan cheese, grated
1 lb ground beef
3 tbsp parmesan cheese, grated
48 oz can chicken broth
1/2 c acini de pepe pasta
1/2 c chopped frozen spinach

preparation

Cook meatballs as you normally would. Keep rolled small. Warm broth. Add chopped spinach and boil. Add precooked meatballs. Reduce to slow simmer. Add acini de pepe until they are fully cooked. Add 3 tbsp grated cheese and serve.

title: 139. CHUNKY ITALIAN SOUP
info:
CHUNKY ITALIAN SOUP

ingredients

1 lb. ground beef
1 onion, chopped
2 cans Italian tomatoes
1 can tomato soup
4 c. water
1 clove garlic
2 tsp. salt
2 tsp. basil
2 tsp. oregano
1 Tbsp. chili powder
1 can kidney beans, drained
1 carrot, chopped
1 (8 oz.) rotini noodles, cooked

preparation

Cook beef and onion; drain. Stir in tomatoes and next 7 ingredients. Bring to boil. Reduce heat; simmer, stirring occasionally, about 30 minutes. Add next 3 ingredients and simmer 15 minutes. Stir in pasta. Pour into soup bowls and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese for each serving.

title: 143. TACO SOUP
info:
TACO SOUP

ingredients

2 lb. ground beef
1 pkg. taco seasoning mix
1 pkg. Ranch dressing mix (dry)
1 jar picante sauce
1 can chilli beans
1 or 2 cans white Shoepeg corn (do not drain)
1 can Ro-Tel (do not drain)
1 qt. tomato juice or 2 cans diced tomatoes

preparation

Serve with tortilla chips and grated cheese. Makes a large pot of soup.

title: 32. FRESH GREEN BEAN SOUP
info:
FRESH GREEN BEAN SOUP

ingredients

1 lb. fresh string beans
2 medium-sized potatoes, diced
1 tsp. salt
2 Tbsp. flour
2 Tbsp. fat
1/4 tsp. black pepper
1/4 tsp. paprika
1/4 c. cold water
1 pt. sour cream

preparation

String and cut up beans. Cook cut beans and diced potatoes in 5 cups of salted water for 15 minutes. In a frying pan brown flour in the fat; add black pepper and paprika. Add 1/4 cup cold water and stir until smooth. Add sour cream. Add this mixture to the cooked beans and potatoes. Bring to a boil and simmer for a few minutes.

title: 173. HAM AND BEAN SOUP OR HAM AND POTATO SOUP
info:
HAM AND BEAN SOUP OR HAM AND POTATO SOUP

ingredients

3/4 to 1 lb. Cook's ham slice
2 cans Swanson vegetable broth
1 can chicken broth
3 stalks celery
3 carrots
1 medium onion
1/4 tsp. fresh ground pepper
3 cans navy beans (not drained) or 3 to 4 potatoes, cubed (with or without skins)
1 stick butter (be sure to use real butter)
1/2 c. flour
3 c. milk (skim works, whole is richer or anything in between)
1/8 tsp. fresh ground pepper

preparation

In large soup pot, add ham, cubed into 1/4 to 3/8-inch cubes, pepper, broth, celery, carrots, onion and beans (cubed potatoes if you are making potato soup), all cut into soup size chunks. Bring to a boil, then turn down to simmer while you thicken milk.

In smaller but heavy pot, melt butter with pepper over medium+ heat. Add flour while whisking. It will get pasty. Slowly add milk while stirring with the whisk constantly. Keep stirring until it boils or just before; the mixture will be quite thick. Be careful not to scorch the milk. By now the vegetables should be cooked. Combine; stir and enjoy.

Remember to scrape the gooey stuff from the milk pot with a spatula; that's the best part. Start to finish, this recipe should only take 25 to 30 minutes.

title: 97. SPLIT PEA SOUP
info:
SPLIT PEA SOUP

ingredients

2 c. green split peas
1 ham bone
2 qt. cold water
2 carrots, diced
1 onion, diced
1 celery stalk, diced
savory
cayenne pepper

preparation

Soak peas overnight. Put ham bone in a large kettle with cold water and simmer 1 1/2 hours, keeping the lid tightly closed. Do not boil. Add peas, carrots, onion, celery and seasonings and continue to simmer one more hour or until peas are very soft. Remove ham bone. Rub soup through sieve and return to kettle. Season further to suit taste, adding salt only if necessary.

title: 65. SCALLOP SOUP
info:
SCALLOP SOUP

ingredients

1 lb. scallops
1/2 stick butter
1 clove garlic
2 stalks celery
3 to 4 medium carrots
2 to 3 medium onions
2 cans chicken broth
salt to taste
white pepper to taste
1 tsp. thyme
1/2 to 3/4 c. half and half
cornstarch

preparation

Sauté scallops in butter with garlic. While sautéing scallops, dice celery, carrots and onions. Heat chicken broth. Add seasonings, vegetables and scallops. Bring to a boil. Lower heat to simmer and cook for about 45 minutes (until vegetables are tender enough to be pierced with a fork). Add half and half. Cook approximately another 15 minutes. Thicken with cornstarch to desired thickness.

title: 48. CREAM OF BROCCOLI SOUP
info:
CREAM OF BROCCOLI SOUP

ingredients

1 c. chopped white onions
3 Tbsp. butter
4 c. chicken broth
1/2 c. rice, uncooked
3/4 lb. broccoli (1 1/2 bunches)
1 c. lite cream*

preparation

Cook onions in 3 tablespoons butter until wilted, 5 to 10 minutes. Add broth, rice and broccoli and cover. Simmer over low heat until tender, 10 to 20 minutes. Puree soup; add cream and reheat. May serve with grated Parmesan cheese on top or chopped dill and butter.

*Evaporated milk or heavy cream may be used for a richer soup. The heavier the cream, the less you will taste the broccoli.

title: 95. VELVET CORN SOUP
info:
VELVET CORN SOUP

ingredients

1 c. finely chopped cooked chicken
1 c. (1 lb.) cream-style corn
1 egg white
1/2 tsp. salt
6 c. chicken broth
1/4 c. cornstarch
1/4 c. water
1 egg white, slightly beaten
1 Tbsp. finely chopped, cooked ham

preparation

In a medium bowl stir together chicken, corn, 1 egg white and salt. In large saucepan heat chicken broth to boiling. Stir in chicken mixture. Stir together cornstarch and water until smooth. Add to chicken broth. Bring to boil over medium heat, stirring constantly, and boil 1 minute. Slowly stir in slightly beaten egg white. Sprinkle with ham. Serve immediately.

title: 163. MICROWAVE CREAM OF BROCCOLI SOUP
info:
MICROWAVE CREAM OF BROCCOLI SOUP

ingredients

1 (10 oz.) pkg. chopped frozen broccoli or fresh broccoli
1/4 c. chopped onion
6 Tbsp. butter
6 Tbsp. flour
1/4 tsp. salt
1/8 tsp. pepper
dash of allspice
1 (13 3/4 oz.) can chicken broth
2 c. milk

preparation

In 2-quart glass casserole, place broccoli, onion and butter; cover. Microwave on High 8 minutes or until broccoli is thawed or tender. Stir in seasonings and flour. Gradually add broth and milk, stirring until smooth. Cover and microwave 10 to 12 minutes, stirring occasionally. Let stand a few minutes before serving. Serves 4 to 6.

Variation: Adding cubed or shaved ham after cooking makes it even tastier.

title: 164. TOMATO FLORENTINE SOUP
info:
TOMATO FLORENTINE SOUP

ingredients

3 Tbsp. basil
1/2 bunch fresh parsley, chopped
3/4 bunch cilantro, chopped
2 green onions, chopped fine
2 stalks celery, chopped fine
3 c. water
1 (48 oz.) can tomato juice
3 Tbsp. chicken bouillon or base
1/2 can of water (tomato juice can)
salt, pepper and Lawry's to taste
1 lb. cooked shell macaroni

preparation

Simmer the first 6 ingredients over low heat until tender, about 45 minutes. Add the tomato juice, chicken bouillon or base and 1/2 can of water. Salt, pepper and Lawry's to taste. Add the macaroni. Heat until hot. May add hamburger to it.

title: 266. CREAM OF SORREL SOUP
info:
CREAM OF SORREL SOUP
(Szczaw)

ingredients

3 Tbsp. butter
1 large onion, sliced thin
1 c. celery, sliced thin
6 c. fresh sorrel leaves, washed and chopped
8 c. chicken broth
2 1/2 c. potatoes, diced
2 bay leaves
1 pt. heavy sour cream

preparation

In soup pot, melt butter. Sauté onions and celery over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add sorrel and simmer three minutes. Add chicken broth, potatoes and bay leaves and simmer until potatoes are tender. In separate pot or bowl, fork-blend sour cream with 3 to 4 tablespoons flour until very smooth, gradually adding a cup of broth at a time (3 to 4 cups). Stir this mixture into soup and simmer several minutes without boiling.

title: 191. HOT CHICKEN ENCHILADA SOUP
info:
HOT CHICKEN ENCHILADA SOUP

ingredients

1 dozen corn tortillas
1 onion, chopped
1 clove garlic, minced
2 Tbsp. oil
1 (4 oz.) can green chilies, chopped
1 (14 1/2 oz.) can beef broth
1 (10 oz.) can chicken broth
1 (10 oz.) can cream of chicken soup (undiluted)
1 (6 3/4 oz.) can chunk style chicken (or use boiled chicken)
1 1/2 c. water
1 Tbsp. steak sauce
1/2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
1 tsp. ground cumin
1 tsp. chili powder
1/8 tsp. pepper
3 c. cheddar cheese, grated
paprika

preparation

Cut 6 tortillas into 1/2 inch strips and set aside. Cut remaining 6 tortillas into triangles and fry in hot oil until crisp; (or you may use corn chips) set aside. Sauté onion and garlic in oil in dutch oven. Add next 11 ingredients; bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat; simmer for 1 hour. Add tortilla strips and cheese. Simmer, uncovered 10 minutes. Sprinkle with paprika. Serve with chips. Makes 8 cups.

title: 211. STUFFED GREEN PEPPER SOUP
info:
STUFFED GREEN PEPPER SOUP

ingredients

2 lbs ground beef, browned and drained
28 oz tomato sauce
14.5 oz can of diced tomatoes with chili peppers, undrained
14.5 oz can of diced tomatoes, undrained
1 c uncooked rice
2 c green peppers chopped (about 2 peppers)
2 beef bouillon cubes
1/4 c brown sugar, firmly packed
salt and pepper to taste

preparation

Place all ingredients in a slow cooker and cook overnight on the low setting.

Makes 8-10 main course servings.

title: 61. POTATO AND SHRIMP SOUP
info:
POTATO AND SHRIMP SOUP

ingredients

1 yellow onion, sliced
1/4 c. butter
1 bunch green onions, chopped
2 medium red potatoes, peeled and sliced
1 Tbsp. salt
2 qt. water
1 lb. shrimp
1/4 c. butter
1/2 c. cream
3 Tbsp. chives

preparation

In heavy 4-quart pan sauté onion in 1/4 cup butter until limp; add green onions, potatoes, salt and water. Bring to a boil and then simmer partially covered for 45 minutes or until potatoes are very tender. Mash. Add shrimp and cook 20 to 30 minutes until shrimp are done. Cool. Add 1/4 cup butter, cream and chives. Adjust seasoning. Heat through, but do not boil or cream will curdle.

title: 190. VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP
info:
VEGETABLE BEEF SOUP

ingredients

1 lb. ground beef
2 large onions, chopped
3 medium potatoes, chopped
1 Tbsp. salt
1/2 tsp. pepper
1 stick margarine
10 oz. pkg. frozen peas
10 oz. pkg. frozen carrots
10 oz. pkg. frozen corn
10 oz. pkg. frozen lima beans
64 oz. tomato juice or 15 oz. tomato sauce
1 large can tomatoes
3 to 4 c. water
1/4 c. sugar (if desired)

preparation

Saut ground beef in large Dutch oven until browned, stirring to separate. Drain off fat. Add remaining ingredients and simmer, covered, for 45 minutes or until all vegetables are very tender. Any leftover meat, vegetables or pasta may be added, if desired.

(Do not use potatoes if freezing the soup.) Great served with cornbread!

title: 296. LOW FAT BEAN SOUP
info:
LOW FAT BEAN SOUP

ingredients

2 (16-oz) cans Navy beans, drained and rinsed
1 can reduced fat chicken broth
2 c. water
1 (6-oz) package diced 97% fat-free ham
1 c. finely chopped onion
1 c. finely chopped celery
1 c. shredded carrots
2 c. diced, cooked potatoes
1/2 tsp. minced garlic
1/2 tsp. pepper
1 tsp. salt

preparation

In large saucepan, cook potatoes until tender. In another large saucepan, combine navy beans, chicken broth, water, ham, onion, celery, and carrots. Bring mixture to a boil. Stir in potatoes, garlic, pepper and salt. Lower heat, cover and simmer for 30 minutes.

Serves 6 (1-1/2 cup servings).

title: 122. CHEESE SOUP
info:
CHEESE SOUP

ingredients

1/2 c. finely chopped carrot
1/2 c. finely chopped onion
1/4 c. finely chopped celery
2 Tbsp. margarine
1/4 c. all-purpose flour
1 c. chicken broth
1/4 tsp. salt
2 c. light cream or milk
1 1/2 c. shredded American cheese (6 oz.)

preparation

In covered saucepan, cook carrot, onion and celery in margarine over low heat until tender. Stir in flour. Add broth and salt. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Stir in cream or milk and cheese until cheese melts and soup is heated through. Do not boil. Makes 4 to 6 servings.

title: 248. DILL PICKLE SOUP
info:
DILL PICKLE SOUP

ingredients

4 large dill pickles, peeled and grated
3 Tbsp. butter or margarine
4 qt. chicken stock
1 c. sour cream
2 Tbsp. flour

preparation

Sauté grated pickles in butter and flour until completely wilted. Add the stock and simmer slowly for one-half hour. In small bowl, stir together sour cream and 1 cup of broth. Stir in to soup and simmer. Serve hot. However, if soup is not sour enough, add pickle juice to taste. Serves 6.

title: 293. EASY POTATO SOUP
info:
EASY POTATO SOUP

ingredients

1 bag Ore-IDA O'Brien (or any hashbrown type potato)
3 cans fat free chicken broth
1 pkg. fat-free Pioneer white gravy mix
1/2 c. water

preparation

Cook the potatoes in chicken broth until soft, about 20 minutes. Mix gravy mix with water and add to potatoes, stirring constantly. Cook until desired consistency. You can add a little shredded cheese on top when you serve it and it is YUMMY.

If you are using the Weight Watchers Plan, this counts as 1 point per cup. Additional points must be added if you add cheese.

title: 130. POTATO-LEEK SOUP
info:
POTATO-LEEK SOUP

ingredients

2 medium potatoes
bottoms of 3 large leeks
1/2 c. celery, chopped
1/2 c. carrots, grated
1/2 c. onion, chopped
1 pt. or more chicken broth
1 small clove garlic
salt and pepper to taste
Accent

preparation

Cook vegetables in enough water to keep from sticking until tender. Add chicken broth and seasonings. Add Accent while cooking.

Serve hot with saltines or other crackers.

title: 76. NEW ENGLAND CLAM CHOWDER SOUP
info:
NEW ENGLAND CLAM CHOWDER SOUP

ingredients

3 large potatoes, diced
1 medium onion, diced
1 stalk celery, diced
1 1/2 c. water
1/2 stick butter
4 Tbsp. flour
2 c. milk
4 slices American or Swiss cheese
1 small can chopped clams

preparation

Cook potatoes, onion and celery in 1 1/2 cups water until tender. Drain vegetables, saving 1 cup water. In saucepan, melt 1/2 stick butter. Add flour and stir until smooth. Add 2 cups milk; stir until creamy. Add 4 slices of cheese. Stir until cheese is melted over medium heat. Add vegetables to sauce; stir, then add clams. Do not drain juice. Pour clams and juice into sauce. Add 1 cup water that you saved from vegetables, stirring constantly until mixture is blended to a smooth consistency. Serves 4.

title: 282. CHICKEN AND VEGETABLE SOUP
info:
CHICKEN AND VEGETABLE SOUP

ingredients

1 c. butter (2 sticks)
2 c. celery, diced
2 c. onion, diced
1/2 c. flour
8 c. chicken stock
1 Tbsp. garlic powder
1 Tbsp. dill weed
1 Tbsp. celery seed
salt and pepper to taste
4 c. fresh or frozen vegetables (your choice)
10 boneless skinless chicken breasts, cooked and diced

preparation

In a large skillet sauté butter, onions and celery until tender. Add flour to mixture, turn heat to low, and cook for about 45 minutes, stirring constantly, until flour mixture is golden in color. Add chicken stock and next 4 ingredients. Turn heat to medium; add cooked chicken and vegetables and simmer until vegetables are tender. Serve immediately.

title: 154. CHEESY BROCCOLI-POTATO SOUP
info:
CHEESY BROCCOLI-POTATO SOUP

ingredients

2 c. chicken broth
1/3 c. chopped onion
1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen chopped broccoli
1 1/3 c. instant mashed potatoes (dry)
2 c. cut-up cooked chicken
2 c. shredded Swiss cheese (8 oz.)
2 c. milk
1/2 tsp. salt

preparation

Heat broth, onion and frozen broccoli to boiling in 3-quart saucepan. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in potatoes until well blended. Stir in remaining ingredients. Heat over low heat about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until hot and cheese is melted. Makes 6 servings, about 1 1/3 cup each.

title: 234. MONTEREY JACK CHEESE SOUP
info:
MONTEREY JACK CHEESE SOUP

ingredients

1/2 c. finely chopped onion
1 large tomato, chopped, peeled and diced
2 large green chilies, seeded, veins removed and chopped
1/2 garlic clove, minced
1 c. chicken stock
1 1/2 c. medium white sauce
1 1/2 c. milk
1/4 tsp. salt
dash of pepper
1 1/2 c. grated cheese

preparation

Put onion, tomato, chilies and garlic in pot with chicken stock; cook until tender. Remove from heat; slowly stir in white sauce, then milk, stirring constantly. Add salt, pepper and cheese. Simmer slowly over low heat until cheese melts. Serve immediately. Makes 6 servings.

title: 230. CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP
info:
CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP

ingredients

1 can kernel corn
5 to 6 large potatoes
2 lb. chicken
1 box bow tie noodles
salt and pepper
rosemary, crushed

preparation

Boil chicken until done. Debone it and put in diced potatoes and corn. Cook until potatoes are done. Put in 2 tablespoons crushed rosemary, salt and pepper. Put in bow tie noodles and cook until tender.

title: 132. MEAT BALL SOUP
info:
MEAT BALL SOUP

ingredients

1/2 lb. ground beef
dash of salt and pepper
1 can Campbell's bean with bacon, minestrone, tomato or vegetable soup
1 soup can water

preparation

Season beef with salt and pepper; shape into 18 meat balls. In saucepan, brown meat balls (use shortening if necessary); cook over low heat 5 minutes. Pour off fat. Stir in soup and water. Heat; stir now and then. Makes about 3 1/2 cups.

title: 223. HAMBURG-PEA SOUP
info:
HAMBURG-PEA SOUP

ingredients

1 lb. hamburg
4 potatoes
1 small onion
1 can peas or 1 can green beans

preparation

Put 2-inches of water in pan. Break up hamburg. Put into water. Chop onion very fine. Dice potatoes. When hamburg is done, add juice off peas. Add potatoes and onion. When done, add peas.

title: 236. SOUTHWEST SOUP
info:
SOUTHWEST SOUP

ingredients

1 large onion, chopped
2 lb. ground meat
3 (No. 303) cans Ranch Style beans
2 cans minestrone soup
1 can beef broth or 2 c. water and 2 bouillon cubes
1 can Ro-Tel tomatoes

preparation

Sauté onions; brown meat and drain. Add all the other ingredients. Season to taste with salt, pepper and garlic. Simmer for 45 minutes.

I usually put this in a crock-pot when I get up and it is ready when I come in. You may add mixed vegetables (Veg-All) and some pasta, noodles, macaroni, etc. Serve with grated cheese and corn bread. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

title: 237. POTATO-LEEK SOUP
info:
POTATO-LEEK SOUP

ingredients

2 Tbsp. margarine
1 c. leeks, chopped
2 stalks celery, chopped small
1 (14 1/2 oz.) can chicken broth
2 cans water
4 medium potatoes, peeled and diced (about 4 c.)
1 Tbsp. chopped parsley
salt and pepper to taste
1 (12 oz.) can evaporated milk
2 Tbsp. flour
1/4 c. water

preparation

Melt margarine. Sauté leeks and celery. Pour in chicken broth and water. Add potatoes and parsley. Simmer 1 hour. Add milk and simmer 15 minutes. Blend flour into 1/4 cup water and stir into soup. Simmer another 15 minutes, stirring frequently.

Notice that I never put a high heat under this. It takes longer to cook, but it does not stick on the bottom.

title: 145. SLOW COOKER TACO SOUP
info:
SLOW COOKER TACO SOUP

ingredients

1 lb. ground beef
1 onion, chopped
2 (16 oz.) cans chili beans, drained
1 (8 oz.) can tomato sauce
2 c. water
2 (14.5 oz.) cans peeled and diced tomatoes
1 pkg. taco seasoning mix
1 can chopped green chiles
1 (15 oz.) can whole kernel corn, drained
1 Tbsp. chili powder
3/4 tsp. cayenne pepper (optional)

preparation

Brown ground beef and drain. Combine all ingredients in a slow cooker and cook on low setting for 8 hours.

title: 299. POTATO SOUP
info:
POTATO SOUP

ingredients

6 medium potatoes
3 c. water
3 c. milk
2 tsp. salt
1 tsp. black pepper
Chives (optional)
1/2 stick butter

preparation

Cut potatoes in small cubes. Pour in water and cook until tender on low heat. Put milk, salt, pepper, chives and butter in and bring to a slow boil. Cook for approximately 3 minutes. Good plain or garnished with grated cheese.

title: 172. STRAWBERRY SOUP
info:
STRAWBERRY SOUP

ingredients

1 c. sour cream
juice of 1/2 lemon
1 c. sugar
1 c. dry red or white wine
4 c. strawberries (fresh or frozen)

preparation

Blend all ingredients well and serve cold.

title: 254. PASTA SOUP
info:
PASTA SOUP

ingredients

1 (14 1/2 oz.) can Del Monte pasta ready tomatoes
3 cans (14 1/2 oz.) low sodium chicken broth
1 onion
1 clove garlic
1 to 2 summer squash, sliced
4 to 5 carrots, sliced
1 (19 oz.) can cannellini beans, drained and rinsed
1 tsp. dried Italian seasoning
4 to 5 Tbsp. fresh basil
1/8 tsp. red pepper flakes
1/2 c. pasta

preparation

Sauté onion in a little oil. Add carrots and squash. Cook 5 minutes. Add garlic and dried seasonings. Add all cans; simmer 30 minutes. Add pasta and fresh basil; cook 15 minutes. Sprinkle with fresh Parmesan/Romano cheese.

title: 114. HEARTY SPANISH SOUP
info:
HEARTY SPANISH SOUP

ingredients

2 lb. beef shanks
3 qt. water
2 cloves garlic
1 onion, sliced
8 peppercorns
3 carrots, sliced
3 zucchini, sliced
1/2 lb. green beans, cut up
salt to taste
3 ears of corn (fresh or frozen), cut into 1-inch pieces

preparation

Start the meat in cold water. Make a rich broth by cooking it slowly with garlic, onion, pepper and salt. When the meat is tender, strain off broth. Add the vegetables (corn last) and cook slowly until done. Add the meat, cut in cubes, to the soup. If extra piquancy is desired, you may serve this with jalapeno sauce. Pick the corn up with fingers.

title: 63. SHRIMP SOUP
info:
SHRIMP SOUP

ingredients

1 can Boston or New England clam chowder
2 cans shrimp soup
1 can cream of celery soup
1 can shrimp or 1/4 lb. fresh shrimp
1 can crab or 1/4 lb. fresh picked crab
1 can minced clams
2 soup cans milk
1 to 2 dashes of Tabasco sauce
2 to 3 dashes of Worcestershire sauce
pepper to taste
sherry to taste
chives or parsley (for garnish)

preparation

Mix all ingredients and heat thoroughly. Garnish with chives or parsley. Serves a large group.

title: 247. MOCK DUCK SOUP
info:
MOCK DUCK SOUP

ingredients

2 to 3 lb. pork spareribs
1 large onion
4 qt. water
5 Tbsp. vinegar
30 prunes (1 box)
1 tsp. marjoram
2 tsp. salt
dash of pepper
1 c. sour cream
1 tsp. cinnamon (optional)
1/4 c. sugar
1/2 c. flour

preparation

Cook spareribs covered with water until it boils. Spill this water out; rinse ribs and start again the same way, adding the onion, prunes and rest of ingredients except flour and vinegar. Cook until meat is tender. Strain soup. Put broth aside. Put all except meat through a sieve. Put pulp back in broth. Mix flour, sour cream and vinegar in blender, then add to broth (while cooking). Cook to near boil. Serve with noodles.

title: 36. SWEET POTATO SOUP
info:
SWEET POTATO SOUP

ingredients

1 qt. peeled and chunked sweet potatoes
3 c. thickly sliced leeks or onions
3 carrots, cut in chunks
3 ribs celery, cut in large slices
2 qt. water
sea salt and pepper to taste
1 Tbsp. margarine
1/4 c. milk
2 Tbsp. toasted sesame seed
1 Tbsp. caraway seed
2 tsp. chopped fresh tarragon or 1/2 tsp. dried tarragon

preparation

Place potatoes, leeks or onions, carrots, celery and water in large kettle. Add salt and pepper. Bring to boil and simmer for 40 minutes. With slotted spoon remove half of the carrots and celery and some of the firmer potato pieces and reserve. Puree the remainder of soup until smooth. Return to kettle and add reserved vegetables, margarine, milk, seed and tarragon. Reheat and check seasonings.

title: 178. SANTA FE SOUP
info:
SANTA FE SOUP

ingredients

1.5 lb. lean hamburger
1 diced onion
1 (16 oz.) can Ranch Style beans
1 (16 oz.) can corn
1 (16 oz.) can stewed tomatoes, cut up in smaller pieces
1 can Ro-Tel (original hot, regular or mild, whatever your family likes; I use regular)
1 lb. Velveeta cheese

preparation

You will need a crock-pot. (I cook in larger pan and then transfer to crock-pot; faster.)

Cook hamburger and onions. Add all ingredients except cheese (do not drain vegetables; use juice). Heat meat and vegetables until ingredients are hot. Cut up cheese in smaller squares and add after the rest is hot. Stir frequently until melted.

I serve with saltine crackers; could use corn chips or Doritos.

title: 31. SENATE BEAN SOUP
info:
SENATE BEAN SOUP

ingredients

1 lb. dried navy beans
1/3 c. margarine
3 medium potatoes, cooked and mashed
1 c. chopped celery
1 c. chopped onion
2 cloves garlic, minced
3 tsp. salt or to taste
1/2 tsp. pepper
chopped parsley

preparation

Wash and drain beans. Put in large kettle with 6 cups water. Bring to a boil and boil 2 minutes. Remove from heat, cover and let stand for 1 hour. Add 2 1/2 quarts water, bring to a boil, cover and simmer 2 hours or until beans are mushy. Add margarine, potatoes, celery, onion, garlic and 3 teaspoons salt. Cover and simmer about 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Add more water if necessary to make a thick soup, then add pepper and more salt if necessary. Sprinkle parsley over each serving of soup when ready to serve. Yields 4 1/2 quarts.

title: 45. BLUEBERRY SOUP
info:
BLUEBERRY SOUP

ingredients

5 c. fresh blueberries, plus additional berries for garnish
4 c. water
4 whole cloves
2-inch piece cinnamon stick
2/3 c. honey
juice of 1 lemon
3 Tbsp. creme de cassis (black currant liqueur)
1 Tbsp. blueberry vinegar
plain yogurt (for garnish)
grated fresh orange rind (for garnish)

preparation

Rinse the blueberries and remove any stems, leaves or green berries. Put the berries in a kettle and add the water, cloves and cinnamon stick. Set over moderate heat and bring to a boil. Stir in honey; reduce heat and simmer, partially covered, until berries are very tender, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. Force the soup through a strainer or through the medium blade of a food mill. Stir in lemon juice, creme de cassis and vinegar. Cover and refrigerate for at least 6 hours. Serve in chilled bowls, garnished with a few whole blueberries, a dollop of plain yogurt and a sprinkle of grated orange rind. Serves 6.

title: 262. BROCCOLI SOUP
info:
BROCCOLI SOUP

ingredients

2 cans cream of chicken or celery soup
2 pkg. frozen broccoli, thawed
2 c. cooked diced potatoes
1 can evaporated milk
1 large onion, diced
2 c. milk

preparation

Add all ingredients to large saucepan and cook over medium heat until creamy.

title: 195. EASY BROCCOLI SOUP
info:
EASY BROCCOLI SOUP

ingredients

1 lb. Mexican Velveeta cheese
2 cans cream of mushroom soup
1 can cream of chicken soup
3 cans whole milk
1 stick butter or oleo
1 box frozen chopped broccoli
medium onion, chopped

preparation

Precook broccoli according to pkg. directions. Sauté onion in butter; add cheese and let melt. Add soups and milk (use soup can to measure milk). Keep stirring to prevent sticking. Add cooked broccoli. Serve with crackers.

title: 141. LOADED BAKED POTATO SOUP
info:
LOADED BAKED POTATO SOUP

ingredients

9 c. cubed, peeled potatoes (use 1 bag frozen hash browns)
3 cans chicken broth
2 cans water
2/3 c. butter
1 1/2 c. chopped onions
2 Tbsp. chives
2 tsp. salt
1 1/2 tsp. pepper
1 can Oscar Mayer real bacon bits
1 c. flour
2 c. milk
1 lb. Velveeta cheese, cubed
1 (16 oz.) sour cream

preparation

In stockpot, add first 9 ingredients. Cook and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes. Combine flour and milk. Stir until smooth. Add to soup and bring to a boil, stirring often. Remove pot from heat and add cheese. Place lid on pot and let sit for 3 or 4 minutes. Stir until cheese is melted completely. Add sour cream and stir together until completely blended.

title: 287. BLACK BEAN AND VEGETABLE SOUP
info:
BLACK BEAN AND VEGETABLE SOUP

ingredients

1 large onion, coarsely chopped
1 Tbsp. Vegetable oil
1 (28 oz.) can whole tomatoes (undrained), coarsely chopped 2/3 c. picante sauce
1 1/2 tsp. Ground cumin
1 tsp. Salt
1/2 tsp. Crushed basil leaves
1 (16 oz.) can black beans, rinsed and drained
1 chopped green pepper
1 lg. Yellow squash or zucchini (or half & half) cut into 1/2-inch chunks (2 c.)

preparation

In large saucepan or Dutch oven, cook onion in oil until tender. Add tomatoes, picante sauce and seasonings. Stir in beans, peppers, and squash; cover and simmer until vegetables are tender, about 15 minutes. Makes about 8 (1 cup) servings.

Suggested toppings: Steamed rice, sour cream, chopped cilantro or parsley, shredded cheese.

title: 298. LOADED BAKED POTATO SOUP
info:
LOADED BAKED POTATO SOUP

ingredients

3 lbs. red potatoes
1/4 c. margarine, melted
1/4 c. flour
8 c. Half and Half
16 oz. Velveeta, melted
White pepper/taste
Garlic powder/taste
1 tsp. tabasco
1/2 lb. bacon fried
1 c. shredded cheddar
1/2 c. chives, chopped
1/2 c. parsley, chopped

preparation

Dice unpeeled red potatoes into 1/2-inch cubes. Place in a large dutch oven, cover with water and bring to a boil. Boil for 10 min. or until 3/4 cooked. In a separate large dutch oven, combine melted margarine and flour, mixing until smooth. Place over low heat and gradually add Half and Half, stirring constantly. Continue to stir until smooth and liquid begins to thicken.

Add melted Velveeta. Stir well. Drain potatoes and add to cream mixture. Stir in pepper, garlic powder, and tabasco. Cover and cook over low heat for 30 min., stirring occasionally.

Place soup into serving bowls and top with crumbled bacon, shredded cheese, chives and parsley.

title: 169. TACO SOUP
info:
TACO SOUP

ingredients

2 lb. ground beef
1 medium onion, chopped
1 can chopped green chilies (undrained)
1 can kidney beans
1 can pinto beans
1 can white hominy
3 cans stewed tomatoes
1 pkg. taco seasoning mix
1 pkg. Ranch-style dressing mix
1 1/2 c. water
salt and pepper to taste

preparation

Brown meat and onions. Add all other ingredients and bring to a boil for 4 to 5 minutes. Reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes. Serve with Cheddar cheese, chopped green onions and crushed tortilla chips on top. Freezes well.

title: 291. CHILI CHEESE SOUP
info:
CHILI CHEESE SOUP

ingredients

1 box potatoes au gratin
8 c. water
1 can chili with beans
1 can Campbell's cream of cheddar cheese soup
1/4 c. margarine
2 c. milk
Salt and pepper to taste

preparation

This is the quickest, easiest soup to make and it is wonderful, thick and hearty.

Bring water to a boil and add the potatoes from the au gratin box. Cook until tender. Add the package of cheese mix, stir well to blend - making sure all of the powder is dissolved. Add the cheddar cheese soup, margarine, milk and the chili. Stir well, let simmer for about 10 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Takes about 30 minutes to prepare, makes about 6 servings.

title: 259. SWEDISH BEAN AND BACON SOUP
info:
SWEDISH BEAN AND BACON SOUP

ingredients

6 strips bacon, cut up
1 c. chopped onion
7 c. chicken broth (from cubes)
1 (15 oz.) can each small white Great Northern beans and navy beans
2 c. sliced carrots
1 tsp. dried marjoram
1/2 tsp. ground allspice
1 small bay leaf
1 large potato, cubed
4 c. shredded cabbage

preparation

Cook bacon in a 5-quart pot over medium heat 5 minutes or until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Pour off all but 1 tablespoon fat. Sauté onion in fat 4 minutes or until soft. Add broth plus 1 extra cup water, the carrots, bacon, marjoram, allspice and bay leaf. Bring to a boil; reduce heat. Cover and simmer 10 minutes. Add remaining ingredients and boil gently 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Discard bay leaf. Top servings with sour cream.

title: 273. CREAMY PUMPKIN SOUP
info:
CREAMY PUMPKIN SOUP

ingredients

3 strips bacon
1 c. chopped onion
2 cloves garlic, minced
2 c. cooked, mashed pumpkin
2 Tbsp. flour
1 can (12 oz.) evaporated milk, divided
3 c. chicken broth
1/2 tsp. curry powder
1/2 tsp. salt
1/4 tsp. pepper
1/4 tsp. nutmeg
sour cream (optional)

preparation

Cook bacon until crisp; crumble and set aside. In a saucepan, sauté onion and garlic in 1 tablespoon bacon drippings until tender. In blender or food processor, puree pumpkin, flour, 1/3 cup milk and onion mixture; add to pan. Add broth, spices, and remaining milk. Bring to boil over medium heat. Boil for 2 minutes. Top servings with dollop of sour cream and sprinkle with bacon. Serve with rolls, fruit, and cheese. Serves 6-8.

title: 205. FRENCH ONION SOUP
info:
FRENCH ONION SOUP

ingredients

3 lb. onions, sliced thin
1 stick butter
8 cans consomme
1 Tbsp. black pepper
1 Tbsp. thyme
dash of salt
2 cans water
1 loaf French bread
Swiss cheese slices
Parmesan cheese

preparation

Brown onions in butter. Add consomme, pepper, thyme, salt and water. Simmer for 1 hour.

Pinch tops and sides of bread and line each individual bowl with 5 to 6 pieces of the bread. Fill bowls with soup, then place a slice of Swiss cheese on each. Sprinkle with Parmesan and paprika just before baking. Bake at 400° until brown, usually at least 15 to 20 minutes.
